story:
Our Story

In 2011, the year-end exhibition will be an integrated event presenting both the Design and Computation Arts student works. The idea behind this approach is to strengthen the connections and collaborations between both programs. In the current semester, professor Martin Racine is giving a new course (Cart 498) focussed specifically on the principles of Exhibition Design and on the planning of the year-end show. We have the desire of trying to go beyond the typical graduation show.

 

Date: April 14 to April 20, 2011.
Location: Concordia EV Bdg, DCart studios, 6th and 7th floors.

The Impact

Our idea is to give the visitors the occasion to understand what the experience of being in the Design and Computation Arts programs is and to share all the steps that are behind the creative process. This year-end exhibition will be helpful to us, students, as a job finder. Also to the new interested applicants, who want to apply into either Design Art or Computation Art program at Concordia University.

 

We need YOUR help to make this important event a success!

What We Need & What You Get

Projected Budget

Expenses

Material: wall, shelves, paint, hardware etc.                 $1500.00

Technical equipment: (audio-visual, spotlights)              $350.00

Signage, Labeling: (Banners & Vinyls, etc..)                   $300.00

 

Advertisements & Publicity:                                              

Posters (300 Posters, Split into 3 print runs of 100)       $300.00

Flyers / Invitations (3000 throughout Concordia)           $550.00

Catalogue (500 Copies)                                               $2000.00

 

Total                                                                           $6,350.00


We are just asking $550 to help the print of the flyers and invitations, however surpassing this amount will help us greatly in funding the other aspects of this project. 

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Pass on the words to your friends, family!

story:
Hi, my name is Felisha and I run Multiplex. The space started last summer and I couldn't be more excited about the artists and musicians we have had here thus far.

I see Multiplex as a place to share, create and interact with the community. Even working full time, I still can't afford some of the more expensive things this space would truly benefit from. Although Multiplex has been running fine, I would love to improve the experience people have when they come here and truly give to the artists that inspire me and those around them.

I am asking for $7000 to transform the space. Mulitplex needs new lighting and fixtures, a projector, a camera for documentation, tools for gallery repairs, a website, and funds for artists, workshops and other events. Even if we do not raise all the money, every dollar earned will go into improving this space. I have grown up in the arts community and now I am at the point where I feel it necessary to faciliate art and music to a community that has supported me. This is my true passion and I feel so lucky to have this many people to share it with!

Not only will we continue to host music and art monthly, we will now be open on the weekends to feature hand-made work from Portland artists and beyond, workshops, talks and much more,

We have some amazing perks for donating to Multiplex! Goods and services from Emotional, Virgin Blood, Tom Whalen, Mel Paget, Alex Ian Smith, Alex Mackin Dolan, Taryn Tomasello as well as some higher donation perks that involve the space. Check them out and feel free to send me any questions you may have!

I know this is just the beginning of this space and I appreciate anything you can offer. There are some amazing artists and musicians in the next few weeks, please stop in anytime!


If you cannot donate,
but want to help, feel free to share this page with people who may be interested. There are Indiegogo share tools that will help boost who sees the page. Even if we don't reach our goal, I would still love for more people to know this space exists so they can come experience it and share with all of us!

 

Thank you so much for taking the time out to check out Multiplex and helping out!!

story:
My name is Michael Jursic. I am an artist, father and schoolteacher living in Toronto, Ontario. My students and I exhibited paintings of haiku poems rendered into QR codes at various downtown Toronto locations for last year's Nuit Blanche.

This year, I'm going it alone.

The project is called, "Voices of Fire."  It will consist of two parts; one auditory, one visual. The first part will be supplied by a karaoke station. The second part is a Standing Wave Flame Tube, also known as a Rubens Tube. The vocal output from the karaoke station will be directed into the Rubens tube, such that the singer will be able to see his voice transformed into in the elemental form of the fire which emanates from the top of the Rubens tube.

If you're anything like me, then you'll get goosebumps over the idea of belting out "Disco Inferno," on a Rubens tube/karaoke machine combo! Or givin' 'er on "Come on Baby Light my Fire!"

I am highly committed to public art, and especially art designed for the rest of us. This installation is designed to be fun and highly interactive. More importantly, it doesn't take itself too seriously.

Your contribution to this project will help create the opportunity for potentially thousands of people to interact with this outdoor piece of art.   As well, part of my ethos as an artist is the fact of my being an Outsider, or vernacular artist. Last year, with "The QR Poetry Project," we found that great art can be created by collective. I'd like to invite you to become part of the collective effort to create this great piece of art. In other words, I'd like to fire up your enthusiasm--but I'll need your help.

 

What We Need

Well, in short, we need about $1400.00 in cash to get the fire started on this project. This will cover the following: materials to make the Rubens tube; propane; karaoke machine and PA rental; safety clothing and equipment (like fire extinguishers); pizza for volunteers. This includes about 10% extra for unexpected expenses. You will be kept abreast of the entire campaign's success and a detailed breakdown of expenses, including copies of all receipts if you wish, will be given to all contributors.

Any extra money will be donated to a children's charity. 

 

The Impact

As you know, I had a very successful run last year with "The QR Poetry Project." I am hoping to bring my artistic talent and project management skills to "Voices of Fire," and take a right turn from QR, to inject a sense of fun into the whole thing.

In donating to Voices of Fire, you'll be helping to make a difference to public art. Remember, when we think of "Art," we often think of highbrow art-school snobs talking about things we can't even understand, or don't think of as art. Well, helping out with this project, you'll be helping to explore the possibilities of art--small "A" art; outsider art--to people who would otherwise sneer at it. Plus you'll be helping lots of people--yourself included--to have lots of fun in the process of learning about public art and its possibilities.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can’t contribute, but that doesn’t mean you can’t help. Here's what YOU can do to help get Voices of Fire off the ground:

Help spread the word! Twitter, facebook, or email it to your friends. You can also use share-tools and links here on Indiegogo.

Volunteer for the night of October 6th. It's going to be lots of fun, and you'll be hanging out with some really cool people who have already offered to help.

If you have any questions or suggestions as to how to make this go more smoothly, email me! I'd love to have your input and help.

story:
Short Summary

I am a contemporary multi-media artist living and working in Colorado's Sangre de Cristo Mountains. My studio practice is centered on the tenuous relationship between humans and the natural world and examines such issues as the human impact on ecological systems and the influences of visual representations of nature on our interaction with the land.

This summer, I have been offered an Aldo and Leonardo Wilderness Science and Art Collaboration residency through Colorado Art Ranch that will allow me to spend one month living in California's Sierra National Forest while I work with scientific researchers to collect data about human impacts on wilderness and make artwork about the data. The project will culminate in a public exhibition of the artwork created during the residency.

 

What I Need & What You Get:

I am trying to raise $1500.00 that will help me realize this project. Purchasing an artwork through this campaign will allow me to fund this project by providing money to purchase art supplies, camping gear, food, and fuel for travel.

The items I am offering as perks are original artworks created by me! Some of the works are part of previous projects or series that explore the relationship between nature and culture; other artworks being offered will be created during or in response to my residency in Sierra National Forest.  

The Impact

I believe that collaboration between artists and scientists is important in broadening our human understanding of the natural world. Scientists and artists both bring different skill sets and knowledge to the project of deciphering the world, and through the collaboration between these fields I believe that we can achieve a more vibrant and complete understanding of our place in and impact on nature. I am very excited about participating in this project and hope that through my artwork viewers might be able to attain a more intense and personal understanding of the scientific data that describes their role the natural world.  

Other Ways You Can Help

Please share my campaign with others!!!

story:
The purpose of starting this IndieGoGo campaign is to raise enough money to be able to have Chest reconstructive surgery with the surgeon of my choice.

.....Some information on the surgery: Chest reconstructive surgery is the most common surgical procedure for female-to-male transsexuals. The most common types of FTM chest surgery are 1) the double incision bilateral mastectomy with nipple grafts, and 2) the  keyhole/periaeriolar incision. Most FTMs who have medium to large breasts opt for the double-incision mastectomy. Two large incisions are made below the nipples, that run across the chest. The surgeon will remove the breast tissue without disturbing the pectoral muscles. The nipples will be completely removed and resized to create the appearance of male nipples, which are smaller than most females. [ref. http://www.femaletomale.org/female-to-male-surgery/chest-surgery/ ] ....

 

Well, where to begin...... I'm not the best at expressing myself but to be able to educate people in turn for an opportunity to have one of my goals in life come true, would be a blessing in disguise. As well as putting myself out there for the whole world to read my story is SO comforting. Haha, just kidding.


Anyway, hello there, my name is Alex[andra] Garita. I was born in New Jersey to a Costa Rican mother and Puerto Rican father and have two awesome older brothers as well.


I've always known I was different since I was in Kindergarten. Yes, I know, that is young BUT when feelings and thoughts occur without any thought.... almost like basic instinct, then it should not be questioned; only embraced.. Not to say that I wanted to jump anyone's bones at that age but it was very clear to me that I was in the wrong body. For example, I remember thinking once (in kindergarten) that if I was a boy then the girls would talk to me. Lest I repeat that this was in kindergarten.


Needless to say, this pattern of thinking followed me throughout most of my elementary, middle and high school.


Middle and high school was probably the hardest if not the worst part of growing up as a lesbian-transgendered. The term "trans" was not popular or only partly accepted by our social culture mostly in part of its lacking expression in our mainstream media.


I was the weird one in class that always sat gym out because I didn't want to change in the girls locker room. In my head I was a boy and couldn't understand why everyone else didn't see it the same way. I went as far as asking the gym teachers if I could change in their office to participate but it seemed as if that was TOO much to ask. (Mind you this was already in high school.)


Backtracking a bit to middle school, is where I began to bind my breasts down, or what little bit of them was coming in at the time, LOL. Of course it was a half ass job and I was still called names nonetheless. "Nipple-i-tis" was my favorite! Ahh, I loved school. Even with the binding, I still did not feel comfortable enough to participate in gym or any physical activity in school even though it was still obligatory.


Being hunched over just to hide my small lady lumps really affected me in many different ways that till this day I am feeling the effects from. For example, my posture paired with my gait are horribly off balance. One side of my torso is more toned then the other due to the overcompensation when wearing different binders assembled with the appropriate attire.

I exercise as much as can specifically for my chest but the same rules apply to breasts as they do to abs: you can do a lifetime of crunches but that belly fat isn't going to disappear by only doing crunches. My mammary gland-filled-flap-jacks aren't going anywhere unless Samantha from Bewitched comes and twitches her cute button nose for these babies to turn to pecs.


Since the likelihood of that happening is close to none, I am here, putting my personal story on IndieGoGo with the chance that you, the reader, can relate to my story or have someone close to you that you can relate this story with.

Thank you for reading. Feel free to contact me with any questions.

story:
The above picture is one of my first prosthetic makeups, done on a friend for a movie.

 Summary

  • My name is Kristian White, I am 15 years old. I also have beautiful red hair ;)
  • I decided to start this campaign because I am very passionate about Special Effects makeup. Halloween showed me my skill in this field and I feel that going to a school at a young age will benefit my future career. 
  • If I attend this makeup school, not only will I have a head start that most makeup artists in the industry don't get, but I will have the ability to take advanced classes others my age don't generally get to take. It will also open the door for great networking opportunities as well as teach me important skills that are vital in this industry. 

This is an opportunity for me to create an amazing life. A little background on me...My mom gave birth to me when she was sixteen, however she was too young to take good care of me. After a while, I was taken from her and a drug infested home and went to live with my great grandma, who then adopted me. My great grandmother, however, was too old for me and I found my days being wasted away in front of video games (although...I'll be honest...they were pretty fun). Eventually, my Aunt took me in to live with her. When I was in 8th Grade, my biological mom died of a heroin overdose, with my 4 year old brother in her arms. This, obviously shook me up, and it was 2 months later that I found a way to express my artistic, deep emotions. I believe makeup is a passion. I am driven by this passion and I would very much like to see where my journey will end up in this industry. I see people and wonder, "How can I make him a zombie?" or I see a scene in a movie and ask, "How can I do that?" Forgive the cheesy comparison, but much like Beethoven, this isn't a passing fad. This is real.   

What I Need

  • To start, I need around $2,000  to afford my first class, an intro Special effects makeup course, which is what any money I receive will fund. Anything over that goal will be saved for future classes to continue my education in this field.
  • Like I previously stated, not many people attend a makeup school at this age, and the opportunities available to me would be much greater the earlier I attend. 
  • If I do not reach my goal here, the funds will still go to my attendance at Ruby Makeup Academy, as I have other money making opportunities outside of Indiegogo.

The Impact

  • This is a valuable fundraiser because it provides me with a rare chance to show the world what I'm made of. One day I could be working on zombies for the 9th season of the Walking Dead and you could be like, "Hey, I helped that guy get to where he is today," and I know that would be a great feeling.
  • I know that this is the job for me, as I have done makeup on so many people and every time I am more and more passionate about it. I know I won't get bored of it and I will always be as passionate as ever.
  • I started this whole thing simply as me being a zombie for Halloween, and my friends saying, "Wow, that's amazing." Ever since then I've been inspired to do the best I can and I honestly feel this will set me apart from a majority of other makeup artists. This would be a life changer for me!

Risks & Challenges

  • The problems I have now are mainly financial, but I feel that shouldn't stop me from doing what I enjoy.
  • Outside of Indiegogo, I am trying to find a job so I can afford this class as well as other classes within this school. While I'm searching though, I thought I would see who would be willing to help me out. I mean to make this happen, I really need your help.

Other Ways You Can Help

  • If you can't donate money, then please try to help me out and see who can. Spread the word about me and my quest for movie magic greatness and tell them my story!
  • Also, don't forget Indiegogo has a share tool, so remember to use it on your Social Media pages!                             
Thanks in advance for all of your help in making this dream a reality!

Anything over that goal will be saved for future classes to continue my education in this field. Like I previously stated, not many people attend a makeup school at this age, and the opportunities available to me would be much greater the earlier I attend.  If I do not reach my goal here, the funds will still go to my attendance at Ruby Makeup Academy, as I have other money making opportunities outside of Indiegogo. 
  The Impact 
This is a valuable fundraiser because it provides me with a rare chance to show the world what I'm made of. One day I could be working on zombies for the 9th season of the Walking Dead and you could be like, "Hey, I helped that guy get to where he is today," and I know that would be a great feeling. I know that this is the job for me, as I have done makeup on so many people and every time I am more and more passionate about it. I know I won't get bored of it and I will always be as passionate as ever. I started this whole thing simply as me being a zombie for Halloween, and my friends saying, "Wow, that's amazing." Ever since then I've been inspired to do the best I can and I honestly feel this will set me apart from a majority of other makeup artists. This would be a life changer for me! 
  Risks & Challenges 
The problems I have now are mainly financial, but I feel that shouldn't stop me from doing what I enjoy. Outside of Indiegogo, I am trying to find a job so I can afford this class as well as other classes within this school. While I'm searching though, I thought I would see who would be willing to help me out. I mean to make this happen, I really need your help. 
  Other Ways You Can Help 
If you can't donate money, then please try to help me out and see who can. Spread the word about me and my quest for movie magic greatness and tell them my story! Also, don't forget Indiegogo has a share tool, so remember to use it on your Social Media pages!                             

Thanks in advance for all of your help in making this dream a reality!

story:
I specialize in artwork that gives you a sense of wanderlust and fantastical feeling. With the Inktober challenge, I took my art to the next level of boundaries by using a limited color palette

This is my first published zine and I am excited to use my 31 InkTober drawings and bonus warm up sketches to fill up this book! Some of the illustrations use Willow and her pet fox Cider, new characters from my upcoming mini comic series "Follow Me". Others tell a deeper story of emotion or play with the boundaries or surrealism.

 

Once my goal is reached I will be including a free sticker for everyone that places a physical order. I will add a new sticker for every 250$ raised!

 

 

 

The Zine

 

 

 

 

Assorted Prints

 

 

Ink Wash Drawing and Custom Card

 

All Inktober Drawings

story: www.theforgedetroit.com
story_txt: www.theforgedetroit.com

story:
What is this Project?

Imagine that you are pregnant and you do not want to be. You are a diligent and caring parent of a two year-old and you just lost your job. You are struggling to make ends meet and your family is helping you pay your bills. Now imagine that you call to make an appointment for an abortion. You can get an appointment for tomorrow, but you are told that it costs $650. Your health insurance doesn't cover this, even though it covers your other medical expenses and it covered prenatal care when you were pregnant with your son. You don't know how you are going to pay your rent. How are you going to pay for an abortion? 

This is the situation that thousands of people are faced with each year in the United States. The Hyde Amendment, passed in 1976, blocks people from using Medicaid to cover abortion. I founded the Repeal Hyde Art Project in 2011 to raise awareness and create dialogue about the Hyde Amendment. Since then, I've taken the project to 15 college campuses, community settings, and conferences. The Project is a colorful, optimistic, and interactive response to Hyde that reflects the self-determination of the people who have overcome it and the hope for change. 

Participating is easy: 1. Print the template from www.repealhydeartproject.org and cut out the bird; 2. Write a message on the bird about why you think that the Hyde Amendment should be repealed; and 3. Hang the birds in a public space.

Sounds easy, right? It is. One conversation leads to another conversation leads to another conversation. The more we are talking, the more politicians will listen to us, and the more likely we are able to make change. We are strong and we fly together. 

So, why do you need this money?

I have been running the Project for two years as a volunteer because I love what I do and I am passionate that art can spark creative change. But I need money to purchase supplies and posters to keep the Project going! The Project is slated to appear at the American Public Health Association annual conference and at Simmons College so far in 2013/2014. I need materials to be able to take it to the conferences and campuses who have extended invitations to me. 

Here's how the funding will break down:

  • I'm asking for $800.
  • $250 will go towards posters, $415 will purchase markers, paper, ink, glitter, etc. so that I have materials to take to conferences/campuses/events.
  • 10% of the total proceeds will benefit the National Network of Abortion Funds.
  • 7% will go to IndieGogo/PayPal

What cool stuff do I get?

  • Everyone who donates over $15 gets an awesome, unique Repeal Hyde Art Project postcard.
  • Everyone who donates over $25 gets an awesome postcard plus a chance to win an autographed Repeal Hyde 18x24 poster.
  • Everyone who donates over $100 gets an autographed 18x24 poster.

I can't donate any money right now.

I get that. If you like this idea, please share this page with your friends!

story:
Craig Paul Nowak is an artist and is not directly affiliated with Indonesia Culture Exploration. However, "I believe in it 100%, and I can't think of a better way to save the Indonesian land that is being destroyed by corporate greed than by arming the people that inhabit that land with the knowledge, confidence, and desire to maintain and strengthen the culture that sustained that land. The loss will be unimaginable. The land and the flora, much of which has never been discovered, will be gone. The animals -the last of their species in the wild - are being killed off.

If I had money I would donate it myself. Money is worthless without great purpose. Unfortunately, I don't have money, but I do have great purpose. I have talent. I have the ability to make art objects the likes of which wealthy individuals have proven to be valuable, and if I can take that one thing I have, that one revered ability, and use it to save the rainforest and the animals within it, then I will do everything in my power to do so.

This fundraiser is in the arts section not because I believe artists care more about animals than would animal lovers. No, it's here because I believe that art lovers care about art, and that art lovers are human, and human beings care about life and history and the planet and whatever fledgling existence of their long lost childhood is left within their contemporary bodies.

I think back to my first painting, the one that first received notable recognition; it was a dinosaur. I painted a dinosaur, a Dilophosaurus, the one with the frilled neck. I remember thinking about how incredible it might have been to see one in person; maybe not that one, but one of the larger, more gentle dinosaurs, absolutely, and not in a cage or in the form of bones in a museum, but in the wild. Well, if we don't act now and empower somebody to protect the Indonesian rainforest in Sumatra then in less than 10 years, that's right, before many of your children will be old enough to drive or go to college or fall in love for that matter, species such as Sumatran Orangutan, Sumatran Elephant, and the White-handed Gibbon will all be dinosaurs.

Future natural history books will know them not as living breathing creatures, but instead as mere history, and we will be remembered as the generation that valued cheap lumber and vegetable oil and alternatives to gasoline more than the existence of a beautiful species or the health and stability of a unique natural wonderland, which is what the rainforest is. Similar tropical environments only exist in maybe two other places, and they are being destroyed too...

Please understand that I can donate art and time and effort but I have no money. I need you to take interest and donate money so that we can help Indonesia Culture Exploration save the rainforest and in doing so, save the animals with it. Thank you for your time."  

-message from Craig Paul Nowak


THE ARTIST

My name is Craig Paul Nowak, and I'm just a normal guy, an 'average joe' artist based out of Detroit, Michigan. I wake up. I paint what inspires me, and I follow my instincts religiously. A few years ago while working at a gallery in Detroit, I humbly made the acquaintance of a remarkable young women. She was roughly my age at the time - less than 30 - strong , mild mannered, and noticeably shy. Deceivingly so, because beneath the surface of her reserved exterior slept an iceberg of a story.

Amity, this powerhouse young woman filled with heart warming passion and breathtaking purpose, the girl that I met in a Detroit gallery that somehow managed to inspire me for three years, and is continuing to do so now in 2014, is the founder of Indonesia Culture Exploration (I.C.E), a non-profit 501c3; "that strives to extend and protect the borders of imperiled tropical habitats within Indonesia", the very same areas that are threatened by palm oil and tropical timber companies.



THE PROBLEM

The decimation of Indonesia's rainforest by palm oil and tropical timber companies is a global threat. Not only do the actions of these companies threaten our planet, but perhaps more importantly, due to an impending threat of extinction, is the threat on the lives of endangered species within the Indonesian rainforest, all of whom depend on the rainforest for survival. And while our planet is arguably strong enough to live through this destruction, authorities have already predicted the likelihood that countless native species will become extinct (est. 1,206 threatened species in Indonesia alone) if the palm oil and tropical timber companies persist.



THE INSPIRATION

National Geographic predicts that wild orangutans may become extinct as early as 2023. That's less than 10 years from now. We have destroyed well over 80% of their natural habitat. To continue this destruction will surely change the world as we know it.

Not only do orangutan serve as the inspiration for this fundraiser via paintings, drawings, and prints as perks, they are also what spurred Amity's decision to lead a peaceful fight against ongoing rainforest commodification and subsequent destruction. It was her almost maternal, or perhaps more accurately, familial connection with Orangutan that lead her to their rescue when she founded Indonesia Culture Exploration. That's right, think less Tarzan and more Jane Goodall.



THE STORY (AMITY)

I was introduced to the world of conservation and environmentalism when I was eight years old. I was assigned a class project having to do with family history, but instead of focusing on my own family, I decided to go to the zoo. I was entranced by the orang-utan as I observed and recorded them for 60 hours total. I found them to be majestic creatures.

Upon completing my 60 hours of observation I turned to my father and declared, “This is what I want to do for the rest of my life!”

He sensed my excitement and asked, “A primatologist?”

To which I responded, “If that is what you call it, then yes, a primatologist.”

I stayed true to those goals throughout my life, eventually becoming a primatologist, working both in captivity and in the wild. I still remember the first time I saw a wild orang-utan; I became as entranced as I was that day at the zoo. And it was then that I vowed to never return to captivity, and to do everything in my power to help the orang-utan population that remained in the wild.

Later I learned of a missing species of fish. A fish that was once native to the Indonesian rainforest had all but vanished. The implications were obvious. The locals and I immediately sensed the negative impact this would have on the local ecosystem, for humans, orang-utan, and all animals alike.

The village elders asked me to talk to the younger generation, to convince them not to give up their cultures and traditions for foreign ways, the same ways that resulted in the missing fish (and eventually the plummeting population of orang-utan and other species). I met with four locals from various villages and pitched my vision of Indonesia Culture Exploration; a non-profit that uses local people and their culture as a platform to protect the rainforests from destruction. They unanimously supported the idea. It was then that Indonesia Culture Exploration was born, a way to protect the culture, the rainforest, and the animals.



THE ANIMALS (ENDANGERED SPECIES)

Below is a list of the North Sumatran animals in the Gunung Leuser Ecosystem that can and will be protected by your donation to this fundraiser and the efforts of Indonesia Culture Exploration:

Sumatran Tiger                  Sumatran Orangutan               Sumatran Rhinoceros

Sumatran Elephant            White-Handed Gibbon              Malay Sun Bear

Argus Pheasant                  Slow Loris Langurs                 Tomas-leaf monkey

Silver-leaf monkey              Siamang                                  Muntjack

Mouse Deer                        Monitor Lizards                        ...and more.



INDONESIA CULTURE EXPLORATION

THE MISSION

Indonesia Culture Exploration is a non-profit organization that strives to extend and protect the borders of imperiled tropical habitats within Indonesia. It is our mission to address the myriad environmental concerns throughout the islands of Indonesia by finding solutions which will alleviate environmental strains in the region.

We believe that in order to achieve this goal, we must educate the world on the diverse cultural backgrounds found throughout Indonesia. By supporting and investing in the cultures of the region, we will protect its most valuable asset-- the rainforest.

Together we can ensure there is forest tomorrow. What makes us different from other organizations? We empower people to empower themselves. We inspire them to protect the earth. Our anthropological techniques lead to building genuine relationships which lead to community support and involvement in protecting the lands surrounding their villages.


THE CAUSE (how your money will be spent)

I.C.E. is looking to acquire a minimum of 3 hectares of primary and secondary jungle that is accessible to all the above animals.

• PRIMARY GOAL: purchase of land

• labor costs for securing the purchased land from illegal deforestation and poaching

ESTIMATED COST: $15,000 usd

Additional funds earned through this campaign beyond that of the primary goal include:

• reclaiming and reforesting abandoned palm oil plantation land

• labor costs for reforestation of reclaimed land and land already owned by I.C.E.

• purchase of indigenous plants for reforestation

• educate the villages nearby about I.C.E. our mission, how the forest is important for the planet and how their community can help get involved

• setting up non-invasive natural structures for ecotourism through I.C.E. programs

• I.C.E.'s clean-up Indonesia's campaign to rid forests, waterways and villages of litter

• overhead costs and operational materials



THE ART PERKS

$30 donation: Signed and Numbered Print

  • Signed and numbered 9"x12" unframed prints of an orangutan ink drawing. The face is comprised of interesting facts about orangutans. 
  • 500 AVAILABLE



$60 donation: Original Drawn "Still" from Campaign Video

  • One original 5"x3" drawing from the campaign film. These "stills" are  transferred onto a canvas using a gloss medium. The images vary. Note: If you donate $7,200 I will combine them all into one large painting with the images descending downward in the order they played in the video.
  • 120 available

Campaign film in progress


$100 donation: An orangutan Portrait

  • Each 8x10 Orangutan Portrait is a one-of-a-kind stencil painting on wood. They will be painted in June and delivered in August, but will be similar in appearance to these self-portraits. Note: you will receive an orangutan portrait, not one of these self-portraits.
  • 100 available



$8000 donation: Orangutan Oil Painting (with Amity's words)

  • One large oil painting, 48"x48". This painting was one of the first paintings done with Amity as the inspiration. It is a detailed painting of an orangutan in red with light blue words painted over the orangutan. The words come from a blog Amity was keeping when she first went to Indonesia to start I.C.E.
  • 1 available

(detail of words)



$12,000 donation: Orangutan and Roo Painting

  • This is a very large painting, 72"x48" and is an adaptation of a Winnie The Pooh image where Roo was sitting with a heffalump. In this painting the Heffalump was replaced by an orangutan with a bird on his shoulder, Roo was painted gold, and the grass was replaced with flowers. It was painted in several of Nowak's signature styles.
  • 1 available



ADDITIONAL FUNDING OPTIONS

I.C.E. Website:

  • http://www.culturexploration.org/donate.html

I.C.E.'s fundraiser on March 15th:

  • http://battle4forests.weebly.com 

Protect Rapidly Vanishing Rainforests:

  • https://onetoday.google.com/p/COkTojce?c=12139570

Let Kids Be Kids:

  • https://onetoday.google.com/p/b5Dcz_HL?c=12139570


ADDITIONAL INFORMATION ABOUT I.C.E.

  • http://culturexploration.blogspot.com/
  • http://www.squidoo.com/indonesia-culture-exploration





*Shipping to donors and minimal production costs of yet to be completed artwork "perks" will be deducted from funds acquired via this fundraiser.

story:
THE ART OF BIG 'O'

The BIG 'O' publishing company first burst upon the swinging London art and music scene during those wild and wonderful psychedelic 60s and throughout the 1970s up until 1980 this poster, calendar, art card and book publishing company produced some of the most amazing and influential fantasy and fantastic and album cover art of all time during the 20th Centuries Golden Age of Poster Art. 

These are the artists you have grown to admire and love over the years ; among them are "Alien" Academy award winning artist HR Giger, also included is perhaps the most recognized album cover artist and creative illustrator over the past 50 years, Roger Dean, and J.R.R. Tolkein and Michael Moorcock fantasy art great Rodney Mathews, as well as David Bowie album cover artist Terry Pastor and Led Zeppelin II album cover artist David Juniper. These are but a few of the uniquely talented artists and their personal stories you will find in this book who contributed to some of the most fantastic poster and album cover art of the 1960’s & 70's and beyond.

From the psychedelic Jimi Hendrix color explosion posters of artist Martin Sharp, to the fantastical beautiful worlds of the YES, and ASIA album cover posters of artist Roger Dean, through the Alien landscapes of H.R. Giger, from the luminous visionary dreams of artist Robert Venosa, and artist Mati Klarwein, to the Wizardry and Wild Romance of artist Rodney Matthews, the Beatles Yellow Submarine illustrations of artist Heinz Edelmann, BIG 'O' was there with the Big, Bigger, The Biggest O!

THE ARTISTS OF BIG 'O'

All of the artists featured here in this book had truly amazing vision, surpassing beauty, they all have stood at different times on very personal thresholds, so gifted and solitary, unique and elusive. Their hallucinatory genius, their almost incantatory mysteries reach the pinnacle of the sublime. This astounding collection of the finest fantasy and fantastic art from some of the most influential and exciting artists of our time has never before been available in one place until now. The gate to the extreme has opened, now all you need is to open your mind and open the cover!

THE ART OF BIG 'O' BOOK

  • The Art Of Big 'O' will be a lavish PREMIUM color 8.5 x 11 inch 192 Page hard cover book which will feature the finest fantasy and fantastic artwork and personal stories from some of the most influential and exciting artists of our time.

Like to see a few sample pages from The Art Of Big 'O' book? You can right  Here!

Like to learn more about The Art Of Big 'O'? Visit the website right  Here!

Oh Boy Do We Have Some Premium Grade Perks For You! 

EXCLUSIVE! We have recently acquired three of the ORIGINAL nearly 40 year old pristine condition size 24 x 36 in.1970's Big 'O' Posters Hand Signed by artist Roger Dean.

Note: If you pledge in a perk containing this item you can pick your favorite from a list I will provide

EXCLUSIVE! We have recently acquired six of the ORIGINAL nearly 40 year old pristine condition size 24 x 36 in.1970's Big 'O' Posters Hand Signed by artist Rodney Matthews.

  • Note: If you pledge in a perk containing this item you can pick your favorite from a list I will provide.

EXCLUSIVE! We have recently acquired one H.R. Giger Hand Signed Poster approximate size 35 x 50 in. that commemorates the 15th anniversary of his Giger Museum that has been generously offered by H.R. Giger for this special perk and personally given by H.R. Giger's U.S.A. agent Leslie Barany.


EXCLUSIVE! I am offering 4 signed and personalized size 24 x 36 in. posters of my Big 'O' art when you pledge this perk. Hand Signed by artist Michael Fishel.

EXCLUSIVE! Hand signed by Terry Pastor. A Rare Size 24 X 24 in. print of his painting “Oh You Pretty Things" from Big 'O' artist Terry Pastor.

  • Big 'O' Artist Terry Pastor's size 24 x 24 in. print “Oh You Pretty Things" is an absolutely stunning and the photo shown here does not even come close to it's actual beauty. This is a signed and numbered artist proof from an limited edition of 195 prints.

EXCLUSIVE! LED ZEPPELLIN II By DAVID JUNIPER. A Size 12 X 8.5 in. beautiful print of his painting for the album cover “Led Zeppelin II" from Big 'O' artist David Juniper.

EXCLUSIVE! An ORIGINAL Hand Signed and Personalized 8 x 10 in. Pencil Sketch by artist Rodney Matthews.

Note: The sketches shown below are for demonstration purposes only.

EXCLUSIVE! We have recently acquired a fantastic selection of the ORIGINAL...And I do mean the ORIGINAL nearly 40 year old 1970's BIG 'O' Art Card Sets in pristine condition.

  • These 4 different Big 'O' art card sets from the artists Rodney Matthews, Mati Klarwein, Michael Fishel and Virgil Finlay are the original over sized 6 x 9 in. Big 'O' art cards that were printed between 1974 and 1979, and sold worldwide.


EXCLUSIVE! THE 2014 ART OF BIG 'O' CALENDAR. 

  • The 2014 Art Of Big 'O' Calendar is a beautiful 11 x 17 in. (opened) high quality 2014 calendar featuring the art of 12 artists from the book with a different image from them for each month of the year. 

Let me begin by telling you a little bit about myself since I suppose you could call me one of the main men behind the curtain so to speak that is bringing The Art Of Big 'O' book project to you here on indiegogo.com My name is Michael Fishel, and I am an artist, and a Big 'O' artist too. Without going into a full biography mode here I will just say that I have pretty much made my living over my lifetime with my art. I have been painting creatively since 1968. I had my paintings published by Big 'O' as posters and art card sets in 1975. I worked for TSR Dungeons & Dragons as a book illustrator for books with cover art by master fantasy artists like Keith Parkinson and Jeff Easley in the 1980s and have painted book cover art for authors H.P. Lovecraft and Richard Adams as well as having my paintings reproduced many times over through the years as posters, prints, calendars, greeting cards and jigsaw puzzles.

My Personal Website:  www.michaelfishel.com

As I said previously while I could be considered the main man behind the curtain that is bringing this exciting art book project to you, I certainly haven't been back there alone however! I would be amiss if I didn't mention some of the other individuals, associates and artist friends of mine who have helped me so much along the way up to this point in my efforts to bring this book to life. People like Peter Ledeboer, the founder of Big 'O', his son Sam Ledeboer and Nigel Suckling who has been editing the book with such great insight and expertise. Individuals like Marcel Salome the master book printer for the artists of Fantastic Realism, artist Christophe Vacher, and H.R. Giger agent Leslie Barany have all helped me tremendously in the design and in the layout of this book. Artist Roger Dean has provided me with generous helpings of encouragement, wisdom, and the gift of his uncanny knowledge of art and design which is in my opinion second to none. I also, can't thank enough artist Rodney Matthews and Terry Pastor who have been so generous with their time in helping to get this book up off the ground by offering their own hand signed original Big 'O' posters and prints from that time, and a big thanks to Doug King who helped me in putting this campaign together. Finally, I want to thank in advance all of you, the fans, the real people that might just actually be able to perform this miracle with me by contributing to this worthy cause here on indiegogo.com because without your support and generosity this book might not of have been even given the chance to see the light of day at all...So, thank you, thank you, to everyone! There are just so many others to credit and mention out there that...er, well, I suppose the only thing that's left for you to do now is just get the book and see for yourself!
Blessings to everyone, and here's hoping for a very successful campaign!

The Goal & What You Get

  • The Goal: l am launching a campaign to raise funds to publish a book showcasing an unprecedented collection of artwork from 18 different artists which will document through images and text the 20th Centuries Golden Age of Poster, and Album Cover Art during the late 1960's and on throughout the 1970's. This very important important era in art history was driven by some of the most exciting and influential artists of that time. It features the finest Album Cover, Sci-Fi, Fantasy and Fantastic Art from world renowned artists Roger Dean, H.R. Giger, Rodney Matthews, Michael Fishel, Robert Venosa, Mati Klarwein, Rudolf Hausner, Jim Burns, Wayne Anderson,Terry Pastor, David Juniper, Vali Myers, Virgil Finlay  and many others. With a goal of $18,000, the majority of funds will be used to pay for the printing and mailing to you of this Premium-Color coffee-table book and hopefully providing a limited amount of funds to help create a companion artists interview DVD and The Art Of Big 'O' Calendar.

  • WHAT YOU GET: The Art Of Big 'O' will be a lavish 8.5 x 11 inch 192 page hard cover Premium Color book which will feature the history and story of the Big 'O' Publishing company as well as showcasing the finest fantasy and fantastic artwork and personal stories from some of the most influential and exciting artists of our time. We also want to have a special page or pages in the book specifically acknowledging you by name. The people who helped me to make the book happen! 

NOTE: An important note to everyone that contributes to this book project. This book will be printed and shipped to you as well as any perks you might choose regardless of the campaign meeting the goal or not. If for some reason unexpected circumstances arise that interrupts my publishing of the book I give you my 100% guarantee that all funds donated by you will be refunded. 

The Lasting Impact Of Your Support

With your help I will use what is raised in this campaign to finish the final touches on the layout and design of the book, and then I will go ahead with the printing of the book to deliver to you the highest quality product that is possible.

I have brought together this collection of amazing artists and would like your support in my effort to preserve these iconic pieces of 1960’s and 70's album cover and fantasy and fantastic art history and to be a part of the journey with me to help finish this lavish full color coffee table book which will not only be treasured now but for future generations to come.

Other Ways You Can Help

I realize that some people just can’t contribute, but that doesn't mean you can’t help:

  • If you really like this project then you can help tremendously just with a post on your social media sites like Facebook, Pinterest, Tumblr etc. So, please help us get the word out and make some noise about The Art Of Big 'O' book campaign...Thank You!
  • And to make it easy for you there are some great Indiegogo share tools to use too!

Want to contact me direct? email: michael@michaelfishel.com

Frequently Asked Questions:

I've changed my mind. Can I get a refund?

Sorry, Indiegogo’s policy is No Refunds. Unfortunately, there’s nothing we can do about this. When your contribution is deposited into our PayPal account, it comes from Indiegogo, not from you. So if we were to refund your contribution, it wouldn't make it back to you. Please see Indiegogo’s rules here.

Can I get multiple perks?

Yes! You can back our campaign as many times as you want, choosing as many perks as you want.

Can I change my perk?

Unfortunately, not during the campaign. But a few weeks after the campaign closes, we will send you an email with a link to a system that will help you manage your perk, input your shipping information, and purchase add-ons if you choose.

You funded The Art Of Big 'O' Book on Kickstarter. Why are you using Indiegogo for The Art Of Big 'O'?

There are a few reasons. First, the experience I had on Kickstarter taught me a valuable lesson: I needed more experience in the fine art of crowd funding! I wanted to use Indiegogo for the benefit of a new experience. Second, I'm moving more quickly than Kickstarter wants. It turns out that they wouldn't allow me to do a second campaign in such rapid succession. Third, Almost all of the wonderful people who pledged on Kickstarter who are partners with me in realizing the dream of getting this amazing book printed informed me that they will help out no matter where the campaign is! So, hello Indiegogo!

story:
About Us

My name is Alycia D’Avino  I am currently an Artist and Owner of Yummi Studios. In 2007 I graduated with a BA in Art Education but was unable to secure a teaching position due to the uprise in the industry. In 2010 I decided to start my own Arts & Crafts company. While managing the business Part Time I maintained a FT position as a Arts & Recreation Director within the healthcare industry. 

In September of 2015 I decided to run the business full time and began taking my Arts & Crafts classes mobile, delivering artistic fundraisers on a large scale, instructing 40-100 guests per class. We were able to donate $26,645 to 30 different charities within the first year alone. Eventually, hauling around such a large amount of metal easels took its toll on my back, which inspired me to create The Pop-Up Canvas. 

Since inception, we have received a tremendous positive response and have had countless requests to bring the product to schools, homes and classrooms of all kinds, not just art classrooms. 

What We Need

Your donation will go towards expanding our inventory and fulfilling the numerous purchase orders that we are unable to fulfill without funding. 

The Impact

With this funding and ability to fulfill purchase orders, we will be able to distribute The Pop-Up Canvas and Kit to schools, recreation centers and homes worldwide. We hope these products will help bring back The Creative Arts to budget cut schools and make Art making experiences more accessible and appealing to all. These products are designed to be used by anyone, not just artists.

We are producing 2 products. The Pop-Up Canvas, and The Pop-Up Kit which comes with all painting materials necessary and video painting instruction, which is accessible from any smart device, and allows for a session of creative expression anytime, anywhere. 

This product will also enable others to host their own Painting Fundraising Events. Many schools and recreation centers have talented art instructors but have been unable to host their own painting events because they are unable to invest in the quantity of easels and brushes needed.

Your donation to our fundraiser means that you believe in the power of creative expression and the impact it has on growing individuals and you share our vision for a more creative world. Your donation is truly an active commitment to changing the world. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Please share

story:
We are the Alliance Française d’Adélaïde and we are turning 110! Since its inception in 1910, the Alliance Francaise has grown to become the beating heart of French language and culture in South Australia. To celebrate our 110th anniversary, we would like to commemorate its history with a mural painting that will leave a lasting impact and celebrate the arts, transforming a drab brick wall into an artistic piece for all to enjoy.

The Alliance Francaise d’Adelaïde was established by Berthe Mouchette and her sister, Marie Lion, in 1910. These two French artists, a painter and writer, moved to Australia at the end of the 19th century, falling in love with Adelaide, and soon became prominent members of the community.  The Alliance Francaise d’Adelaide would like to celebrate Berthe and Marie’s artistic legacy, and highlight the special love between France and Australia that has allowed the school to grow and thrive for over a century.

The streets of Adelaide are like an outdoor art gallery, and the Alliance Francaise would like to enter our own piece into the collection. We’re hoping, with your help, we can make something beautiful and lasting - a mural that adds a touch of France to the city of Adelaide.

 

To show our appreciation for your support, the Alliance Française has the following rewards on offer:

  • Project updates on the progress of the mural
  • 'Thank you' credit in video documenting the creation process

 

  • Commemorative postcard
  • Project updates
  • 'Thank you' credit

 

  • Double Pass to the French Film Festival
  • Pamper Pack filled with goodies
  • Commemorative postcard
  • Project updates
  • 'Thank you' credit

 

  • Invitation to our Inauguration Event for the Opening of the Mural
  • Commemorative postcard
  • Project updates
  • 'Thank you' credit

 

  • One Year Membership to the Alliance Française d’Adélaïde
  • Commemorative postcard
  • Project updates
  • 'Thank you' credit

 

  • One Term of Classes at the Alliance Française d’Adélaïde
  • Commemorative postcard
  • Project updates
  • 'Thank you' credit

 

We are aiming to raise AUD$6000 for this project. This will help in covering the costs of:

  • Artist fees
  • Mural maintenance
  • Campaign fees

Whilst we are hopeful that we will be able to reach our goal, the funding of this campaign is flexible and any support received will still be helpful in bringing this mural to life - even if we do not ultimately reach our final goal. 

 

The painting of the mural is scheduled begin in November with completion in time for the inauguration event in December. We endeavour to keep to this schedule; however, if circumstances were to change, backers would be notified and updated. Additionally, if restrictions are to return in the event of another wave due to the current COVID-19 pandemic, the inauguration event would be cancelled and those who have chosen the relevant perk would be contacted. The event would then be rescheduled as soon as it is safe to do so.

 

We understand that not everyone is able to contribute but there are other ways to help! If you have some time, we would appreciate some help getting the word out and making some noise about our campaign. Don't forget the Indiegogo share tools so that you can share our project online with your family and friends! 

Follow us on:

Facebook   |   Instagram   |   Website
story_txt:
We are the Alliance Française d’Adélaïde and we are turning 110! Since its inception in 1910, the Alliance Francaise has grown to become the beating heart of French language and culture in South Australia. To celebrate our 110th anniversary, we would like to commemorate its history with a mural painting that will leave a lasting impact and celebrate the arts, transforming a drab brick wall into an artistic piece for all to enjoy.

The Alliance Francaise d’Adelaïde was established by Berthe Mouchette and her sister, Marie Lion, in 1910. These two French artists, a painter and writer, moved to Australia at the end of the 19th century, falling in love with Adelaide, and soon became prominent members of the community.  The Alliance Francaise d’Adelaide would like to celebrate Berthe and Marie’s artistic legacy, and highlight the special love between France and Australia that has allowed the school to grow and thrive for over a century.

The streets of Adelaide are like an outdoor art gallery, and the Alliance Francaise would like to enter our own piece into the collection. We’re hoping, with your help, we can make something beautiful and lasting - a mural that adds a touch of France to the city of Adelaide.
 

To show our appreciation for your support, the Alliance Française has the following rewards on offer:


Project updates on the progress of the mural
'Thank you' credit in video documenting the creation process

 


Commemorative postcard
Project updates
'Thank you' credit

 


Double Pass to the French Film Festival
Pamper Pack filled with goodies
Commemorative postcard
Project updates
'Thank you' credit

 


Invitation to our Inauguration Event for the Opening of the Mural
Commemorative postcard
Project updates
'Thank you' credit

 


One Year Membership to the Alliance Française d’Adélaïde
Commemorative postcard
Project updates
'Thank you' credit

 


One Term of Classes at the Alliance Française d’Adélaïde
Commemorative postcard
Project updates
'Thank you' credit

 


We are aiming to raise AUD$6000 for this project. This will help in covering the costs of:

Artist fees
Mural maintenance
Campaign fees

Whilst we are hopeful that we will be able to reach our goal, the funding of this campaign is flexible and any support received will still be helpful in bringing this mural to life - even if we do not ultimately reach our final goal. 
 

The painting of the mural is scheduled begin in November with completion in time for the inauguration event in December. We endeavour to keep to this schedule; however, if circumstances were to change, backers would be notified and updated. Additionally, if restrictions are to return in the event of another wave due to the current COVID-19 pandemic, the inauguration event would be cancelled and those who have chosen the relevant perk would be contacted. The event would then be rescheduled as soon as it is safe to do so.
 

We understand that not everyone is able to contribute but there are other ways to help! If you have some time, we would appreciate some help getting the word out and making some noise about our campaign. Don't forget the Indiegogo share tools so that you can share our project online with your family and friends! 
Follow us on:
Facebook   |   Instagram   |   Website

story:
Short Summary

The Downtemple is a collective collaboration of artists, performers, musicians, and healers who seek to create an immersive space at Photosynthesis Festival 2014. We are seeking help with funding to create the stage facade and entrance portal. 

The temple architect is Matt Matsuda, a recent graduate of Cornish College in Sculpture.

To view the schematics for the Portal and Stage please visit :

http://sudapop.com/post/90672660968/downtemple-concept-art-for-photosynthesis-festival

What We Need 

  • Materials Costs : Plywood  ($50 per sheet) x 6 sheets ($300)
  • 4x4 wood stakes ($20 per stake) x 4 ($80)
  • CNC Router costs : ($60 per sheet) x 6 sheets ($360 total)
  • Transportation costs : Truck rental x 2 ($30 per) ($60)
  • Labor ($200)
  • TOTAL COSTS : $1000

Risks & Challenges

Our biggest constraint at the moment is funding. The designs have been created and we have a CNC shop ready to make the cuts. We are in need of like minded individuals who are willing to co-create this immersive environment for the West coast festival community.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you are unable to contribute money, please share this page with your friends and help us to make our vision a reality.

story:
Why Does Fun-A-Day Matter?

Fun-A-Day is one of the largest, all-ages, non-curated art shows in the entire state of Delaware and - with your help - we can continue to put on this amazing community event. 


We are not a formal organization but a volunteer-run collective of artists and art enthusiasts - Kati Driscoll, Sarah Houghton, Sheila Master, Valerie Thiel and Alan Brown form the Delaware Fun-A-Day team.

Delaware Fun-A-Day has doubled its size year over year which is awesome news! 2014 has seen a further increase in participants - which also means an increase in costs. In 2012 and 2013 100% of Fun-A-Day up-front costs were provided by the people organizing the event, with donations helping to alleviate a fraction of the expense.

If you loved being a part of such an epic art project and show last year, if you enjoyed attending the event, or if you're in support of accessible and affordable community art shows then please make a donation.  

We would easily reach our goal if...
Every artist who is participating donated $15 - $25
OR all our Facebook fans donated just $10 
OR every attendee from last year's show donated only $5!

We are doing something amazing & totally different. Be a part of it!


Where Does My Donation Go?

To accomplish our goal of keeping Fun-A-Day free and accessible to persons of all income levels, we are asking for your financial support. Your donation helps us pay for:

  • Space rental 
  • Web maintenance 
  • Hanging supplies 
  • Paint and repair materials
  • A/V supplies 
  • Event supplies
  • Food & beverage
  • Administration 

Although we reuse items year after year and use recycled items for display or decoration purposes, we still have new or unexpected costs involved with an event of this scale.  Any additional funds received or not used in 2014 will be rolled over to support future Fun-A-Day events.


What Rewards Are Being Offered?

We are glad you asked! Prizes range from a virtual head nod to an extravagant evening on the town, curated art collection and champagne toast at the 2014 show. Scroll down for more details or if you really, really love GIFs!


Starving Artist? Other Ways to Help!

If you cannot pledge anything at the moment, but believe in our mission and dig what we're doing, please share our fundraising effort with your friends. 

  • Share our fundraising efforts on Twitter (#defunaday)
  • Share this campaign on your Facebook timeline or page
  • Share our fundraising info on Google+
  • Like us on Facebook
  • Spread the word to your friends and family


OK! On to the REWARDS!

// PRINTS - $15 ea.//

// TOTE BAGS - $25 ea. //



// WOOD TRANSFER NECKLACES - $25 ea.//


// SWAG TRIO - $35 //
Not to scale, obviously.


// SOY WAX PYRAMID CANDLE - $35 //
Vanilla or Lemon Verbena. 


// GLASS TILE TRANSFER - $50 ea. // 




// LTD. EDITION LEATHER CLUTCH - $50 ea. //



// WOOD TRANSFER ART - $50 ea. //


// FUN-A-DATE - $1,500 //

story:
Influx, In Flux -- Cre8tive YouTH*ink & The Centre-Fuge Public Art Project will collaborate to work with teens on a series of murals for the Ideas City Festival 2013 at The New Museum 

 Empowering, Encouraging, Creating, Educating, Reclaiming

Urban youth team up with artists Ray Smith, Sofia Maldonado, Sheryo & The Yok, ND'A, Claw Money, Cram Concepts, Yuri Velez and many other top artists from the Centre-Fuge Public Art Project to create a series of murals along First Street on the Lower East Side, May, 1-4, 2013

This project, Influx In Flux, will create a series of community-based murals pairing urban teens with neo-surrealist painter/scuptor Ray Smith; supermuralist Sofia Maldonado; internationally renowned Brooklyn-based street artists Sheryo & The Yok and ND’A; graffiti legend Claw Money; graphic designer extraordinaire & graffiti artist Cram Concepts; artist/musician Yuri Yelez and many more in the creation of public art along First Street on the Lower East Side.

 
Youth is a stage of life marked by uncertainty and challenge - a time of enormous potential, enthusiasm and energy. But, it is equally true that youth are apt to experience alienation, rolelessness, and restlessness, as they work through the transition into adulthood.
 
Cre8tive YouTH*ink engages an urban youth constituency, partnering teens up with working artists, and reviving the spirit of apprenticeship in the arts through the "Art School Without Walls."
 
Centre-fuge Public Art Project brings together communities that are being broken apart by congestion and blocked road-ways, acting as a catalyst for the future pursuit of creativity, making art available to an under-engaged urban populace.
 
By integrating contemporary art with aspects of community, social justice and the reclamation of surplus space, this project gives youth a voice and a place to comment on the invisible forces that shape their lives. With arts programs dwindling, engaging restless youth in an art school without walls, reawakens and encourages a new generation of art makers.
 
Engaging youth in transforming transitional spaces, not only inspires an upcycled mentality but also reaffirms that there exist endless possibilities surrounding us that are a rich source of untapped capital.

Influx, In Flux   -   Ideas City Festival at New Museum   -   May 1-4, 2013

All funds raised will go towards the project's production costs, including materials & apprentice stipends. Any amount beyond our funding goal will serve to increase apprentice stipends. So, won't you help us to reach our funding goal? Thanks!

story:
Paradise Found!

     Snow blanketing the landscape outside my middle school classroom windows each northern winter fueled my desire for sunny skies and warm vistas without a snow shovel in sight!  Finally stepping off that plane at Southwest Florida Regional Airport felt like coming home.  Walking through the vast expanse of lobby I was immediately captivated by the way in which art is used to announce the cultural diversity and visual impact of this tropical paradise. 

      I subsequently discovered that.....  "The Cultural Exhibits Program is a component of the Southwest Florida International Airport Art Program. Established in 2010, this program is free and available to local and regional cultural organizations, individual artists and collectors who have art and artifacts of public interest with artistic merit, cultural significance or educational value. The purpose of this program is to showcase the diversity of art and culture in the Southwest Florida Region." ...from the RSW website 

     Having retired from teaching art in the cold, cold North, I am now able to paint full-time; inspired daily by my surroundings in this beautiful environment.  I have a Bachelor's degree in Fine Arts from the Maryland Institute, College of Art in Baltimore, MD USA. I have taught art in the public school system in Maryland for thirty-five years as well as offered private instruction in watercolor to many adults.  I have exhibited my work at many venues in my native Maryland as well as at the Gasparilla Festival of Art in Tampa, at the Naples Fall Art & Craft Show and at ArtFest Fort Myers.  

     Currently I am preparing a proposal to exhibit at the Southwest Florida Regional Airport as part of their "Ärt in Flight" program.  I will need about 20 pieces of original work to accommodate the exhibit space.  To that end I have completed the first seven:  "Magnolia in Leaves", "Passionflower Party", Ünder the Coconut Palm", "Plumeria in Sunlight", "Night-blooming Cereus", "Pink Bromeliad with Pup" and "Birds-of-Paradise ". 

    I am focusing on the flora surrounding me in this southwest paradise.  Additional pieces will showcase the Gloriosa Lily, the Hibiscus varieties, Water Lily, the Canna, the Mahoe as well as foliage plants that include Croton, Purple Queen, and Copperleaf and other succulents similar to "Pink Bromeliad".  The seven completed pieces for this Florida series can be viewed on the Gallery page as well as in the video on this site and at my website link below, where you will find other images of my work also.

    Due to the cost of fine art materials, professional framing, a hanging/display system, publicity, brochures and other expenses necessary to execute the exhibit; I am in need of financial help to make this happen.

HOW YOU CAN HELP:

My project is two-fold; first creation and then exhibition.  For that reason I have broken down the costs as follows:

PART 1:    CREATION  Time frame: 3 to 6 months

The additional 13 pieces will require funding as follows::

  • Fine Art watercolor inks (supplement current supply).......$150.00
  • Roll of Arches cold-press 140 lb watercolor paper............$180.00
  • Framing for 13 paintings (depends on sizes).approx   ...$2950.00 
  • Indiegogo fee & unanticipated misc. costs............................650.00

                                                                                          Part 1 Total: $3930.00

PART 2:    EXHIBITION   Time frame: undetermined at this time

  • Trailer to move paintings to/from exhibit location ($150.x2)....................................................................................$300.00
  • Exhibit Insurance  .....................................................................$250.00
  • Security ....................................................................................$1500.00
  • Publicity, Signage, Brochures, Shipping. .............................$350.00
  • Unanticipated costs (misc.) ....................................................$150.00                                                                         

                                                                                          Part 2 Total:  $2550.00 

                                                                    Total funds required;   $6530.00 +/-

    Accompanying the exhibit will be a prospectus detailing the unique attributes of each of the floral images so that visitors to this beautiful area will recognize and gain an appreciation for the exceptional environment into which they have come.

    If, with your help, I reach my goal then it's GO as planned. But because I have been a teacher, I have learned to always have PLAN B...short for back-up plan.  So here it is:  

Since framing and security are the largest costs I will:

  • seek an alternative to professional framing by searching thrift stores and recycle locations for framing that can be altered to look spiffy! It is important that the pieces all look cohesive once framed so it will either be all professionally framed or all will be framed with recycled frames (attractively, of course!).
  • enlist the help of family, friends and friends of friends to help provide security for the length of the exhibit.
  • also I will trim some of the costs for signage/brochures by reproducing these items myself, using MS Publisher
  • seek alternative exhibit space in other public venues (i.e. Alliance for The Arts, local government spaces, local hospitals andpublic areas that court visitors) should the airport venue be unavailable in the immediate future.  The scope of their exhibits encompasses 36 months so I have to be flexible with an exhibit time frame.

WHAT YOU GET FOR HELPING ME:

  • Good feelings knowing you have offered support to promote the arts and thereby made a difference in the world.
  • Own a piecce of art from a soon-to-famous artist!  ;-)
    • bookmark  2"x4"
    • postcard     4"x6"
    • card reproduction   5"x 7"
    • print, matted          8"x10"  matted & framed
    • original painting     8"x10"  double matted & framed
    • original painting   18"x24"  double matted & framed
    • original painting   28"x30"  double matted & framed

 

     If you are a nature lover (particularly of flowers) then you have already experienced the quiet joy and peacefulness nature brings the eyes and the soul.  But it is fleeting, so I paint these beautiful examples of God's handiwork as a permanent window into Nature's beauty.  I have been grateful my whole life long that I see with an artist's eye.  It gives me many serene moments.  It is the view through the artist's eyes that I want to bring to everyone who is fortunate enough to step into this Paradise found!

 

 

    Don't worry...if you like my work and my project but can't support me financially, just help me get the word out.   Tweet me, FB me, Stumble me, use your address book and reach everyone you know.  Blessings on you... again and again.

story:
What is it?

It's a calendar! And when 2018 is over, it's 12 Badass prints!

  • Each month features a hand-drawn portrait of a Badass Woman and important dates to remember.
  • Including such badasses as:
    • Maxine Waters
    • Sister Rosetta Tharpe
    • Elizabeth Peratrovich
    • Laverne Cox
  • Important dates include:
    • July 2: Civil Rights Act (1964)
    • September 4: Beyoncé's Birthday
    • October 26: Brownsville Clinic Raid (beginning of Planned Parenthood, 1916)

 

How much is it?

  • Each calendar is priced at $20, with discounts for bulk orders
    (4 for $70, 10 for $150, 20 for $200)
  • **If you would like an amount not listed as a , OR if you intend to pick up locally please click BACK IT and enter the appropriate amount (without shipping). For example, if you want 6 calendars for $100, or 30 calendars for $300. Please contact me if you have any questions!**
  • The goal fund of $3000 covers ~60% of printing costs
  • Pre-ordering guarantees you get a copy and helps me know how many to ultimately print!
  • Pre-ordering during this campaign includes FREE shipping for individual calendars and significantly discounted shipping for bulk orders!

 

Why a Badass Women Calendar?

I was blown away with the support that the 2017 Badass Women Calendar received, and I'm so excited that y'all want more!

A little about last year's calendar:


 

I'm using this project to specifically lift up Badass Women of color, queer Badass Women, and people who may not usually get as much attention for being badass, even though they have made awesome contributions to the fight for equality.

This feels like an important and fun project to me because I get to celebrate Badass Women and hopefully inspire people throughout the year (plus I get to draw and learn about some incredible humans).

 

Risks & Challenges

If you pre-order a calendar, you will definitely receive one (unless some unforeseen circumstances prohibit the whole project from finishing, in which case, you'll receive a refund).

There is a small general risk your delivery could be delayed by USPS. (If you do not receive your calendar by Thanksgiving, please contact me)

 

Other Ways to Be Involved

  • Even if you can't pre-order a calendar right now, you can totally share this with your mom and hint that it would make a GREAT gift, or tip off your local badass boutique to order some wholesale.
  • Please share this with someone who you think would love this project! <3

story:
Chut Tsang: Dad & Painter

Hi my name is Norm and this is my dad, Chut Tsang. Growing up I not only saw him as a hard working fortune cookie maker, but I also saw him as a talented artist who enjoyed painting.

I remember when I was a kid he would bring me to these galleries and meet his fellow artists. It was so amazing to me to see entire worlds unfold on his canvases. Moments and stories that would never have existed if he hadn't translated them into life on paper. This is what inspired me to pursue film-making.

5 years ago, He was diagnosed with Parkinson's disease. As time progressed his symptoms have become more prevalent, but I remember the man before this.

It's been a couple of years since I originally had this idea, but its now slowly coming into fruition. On March 29, 2014 I will be curating my dad's paintings in NYC's lower east side.

This will mark his very first gallery opening exclusively showcasing his paintings and I would like the opportunity to share it with the world, well at least with friends and family in New York City.

Through this I hope not only to raise awareness for Parkinson's disease, but also to inspire him to pick up the brush again, the way he inspired me to pick up the camera many years ago.

What We Need & What You Get

Even though he has a great body of work, his paintings are not currently framed. I started this campaign to help fund the purchase of the framing that his paintings deserve and the cost is estimated around $1,000. I would like to ask for your support to help make my father's dream come true.

DynastyStyle has generously donated some cool swag as perks for this campaign. 

DynastyStyle is an arts community whose mission is to bring artists from all walks of life together to learn and create together.

Spread The Love!

I totally understand that times are tough so if you're not able to contribute here, please spread the word about the campaign by word of mouth and using the Indiegogo share tools. The gallery opening will be open to the public on March 29, 2014 and we would love to see you there!

Stretch Goals

We made it and with 12 days left until the end! We're truly blessed to have people who really believe in this campaign. God provided us with the will and strength to see this through and make it happen with all the different pieces falling into place at the right time.  There is no amount of words to fully express our gratitude, but thank you all for the support and we want to see your faces at the gallery on March 29! Also, whatever is raised beyond the goal will go towards Parkinson's research and awareness. We are currently looking at 2 foundations: Parkinson's Disease Foundation and Michael J. Fox Parkinson's Foundation.
