story:
Dear Friends, Family, Colleagues, Visionaries, Lovers of Art and the Road... 

Please help us launch an exciting art project off the ground, into the clouds and then back down to earth at dOCUMENTA(13)!  Itinerant Structures: Traveling Medicine Show & Empanada Stand is a pop-up sculptural cafe and performance space operating in a fictitious economy, where theater, food and beauty are offered in exchange for ideas. The work will involve seven artists and premier August 2012 in Berlin with a gallery exhibition, curated dinner and public events. It will then go on to join the global discourse of art and thought at dOCUMENTA(13) in Kassel, Germany. We are running with the state of mind of dOCUMENTA, breaking down hierarchies between cultures and art forms. Join us in this endeavor to bust open intellectual, artistic and culinary straightjackets by contributing money to the Traveling Medicine Show and Empanada Stand!

Thank you in advance for making a wild and beautiful idea possible,

Ann Schnake and Elizabeth Dorbad

Artists & Project Directors

 

About Us

Over the last 20 years, Elizabeth Dorbad and Ann Schnake have made sculpture, installation and performance works in museum and gallery settings, junkyards, health centers, meat lockers and street corners. With a lifelong interest in traveling circus and sideshows, Elizabeth had her first solo exhibition in a medical museum that specializes in human oddities. Her current installation works deconstruct theatrical forms and dissolve the boundaries between the space of sculpture and that of performance. Ann engages with the poetics of the body in failing economies by making installations, spare organs and parts, and performative meals, a labor informed by decades of work in hospitals and county clinics. We see the gates of art as permeable and are intrepid in bringing our friends, families, other artists and total strangers along with us. We operate with a premise of mixing mediums, stretching possibilities and doing what it takes to enact ideas while following singular threads to the ends of the earth. Our work and biographies may be viewed at:

www.annschnake.com

www.elizabethdorbad.com 

http://unspeakableprojects.com/artists/elizabeth-dorbad/

 

Locations

This project’s nomadic trek will take us to three locations: the San Francisco Bay Area and the German cities of Berlin and Kassel.  We will begin in the Bay Area July 2012 and premiere in Berlin during the month of August with a gallery exhibition, choreographed artist dinners and pop-up events in public venues.  In late August, we will travel to Kassel to build a temporary installation and performance piece curated by the Critical Art Ensemble for dOCUMENTA(13). We are honored and delighted to intertwine the gustatory and the aesthetic as we become a part of the conversation, artistic production and ripple effect of dOCUMENTA(13) --this is a huge artistic endeavor for us! 

Artists formed the first documenta in 1955 as an action that represented the banishment of the cultural darkness of Nazism.  Now attended by over 750,000 visitors, documenta occurs every 5 years, and lasts for precisely 100 days; it is considered by many to be the most important exhibition and site for ideas in the contemporary art world. Every documenta has wrestled conceptually and politically with the issues of its times and historically has become a source for defining and revolutionizing contemporary culture. 

The Art!  

We are building a mobile installation and creating vignettes in various locations, from gallery to lecture hall to park, while bringing a five other artists into the mix. Imagine a visually evocative tent made of discarded materials, as installation, with props and characters to flesh out the scenario: wooden masks and limbs to create mobile identities; scrolls of essential questions such as recipes for potions to cure the ills of failing economies and social systems; a large tornado puppet that represents contemporary wilderness and upends order; soapboxes for standing on and walking over. 

Performance artists in Berlin will help us enact these characters, from a confused waitress playing a violin to a bureaucrat grilling customers for illuminating thoughts. In this whirling space, we will periodically serve empanadas and slivovitz in exchange for ideas and create an atmosphere that invites chewing over thoughts. We have chosen empanadas, as a quintessential nomadic food, convenient for a traveler’s pocket. Since we will be enacting the project as travelers ourselves, the view from the road gives us playful boldness to build inclusive creative acts on an international platform. We imagine our empanadas and other tarts as an opening to conversations and engagements, a magical agent of erosion to artistic, social, economic, and geographic boundaries. 

The Traveling Medicine Show is a mythologized tent, a mobile station, a symbol of the American Spring and of the people living on the borders of cities and economies worldwide. Early medicine shows hawked snake oil and ”Indian medicine” for curing ills, bringing ideas of the wild, magic and entertainment to the bored and the desperate of small towns. We will peddle the occult, cacophony and suggestion of the types of far reaching possibility that emerge from hurricanes and erratic weather systems, feminine wilderness, domestic kindness gone feral and good empanadas. 

We are particularly excited about our collaboration as a convergence of our interests in itinerant structures…both architectural and societal, economies run amuck, and the physicality of eating and performance  --all wrapped around the colorful social platforms of both café and traveling medicine show! 

 

What We Need & What You Get

By August 21st, we need to raise $8,000 to support the materials, travel, and logistics of this project, involving seven artists and thousands of viewers. Your  tax deductible contribution will support the making of sculpture, puppets, masks, a tent, a mobile cooking and serving unit and all the physical and performative elements of the Traveling Medicine Show. It will also support the airfare, train and other transport of the project along with support for our collaborators in Germany. Access to a kitchen and a studio will allow us to make sculptural pieces as well as hundreds of empanadas. In some instances there will be a charge for the food served, but the economy of a café where food is paid for with ideas offers a provocative platform; thus your donation will support a lively international discourse and a reimagining of value, exchange and property in dramatic economic times. 

As artists we are enchanted to make art and products directly related to these themes specifically for you, to show our appreciation for your contribution. From cakes to Joseph Beuys handkerchiefs to theater and disaster photographs to cast bronze sculpture, we see these products as a rich part of our artistic production and an interweaving of objects with ideas that symbolize this particular body of work.  If you are interested in purchasing art and you do not see it here, now would be an excellent and helpful(!) time to do this.  Please contact us if interested!

SEE IMAGES OF OUR PERKS IN THE ATTACHED GALLERY!

Other Ways You Can Help

Please pass the word to people you know and ask them to do the same!  More support = more performance possibility and further exchange between artists and viewers internationally. You can also help us by giving us ideas—what do you think are the most pressing and radical questions to ask artists today? Send us suggestions of questions to pose to viewers at dOCUMENTA(13). 

What Next? 

Traveling Medicine Show will return to the Bay Area in the Fall with a whole series of visuals, performances and meals informed by a rich international artistic conversation.

With a lifelong interest in traveling circus and sideshows, Elizabeth had her first solo exhibition in a medical museum that specializes in human oddities. Her current installation works deconstruct theatrical forms and dissolve the boundaries between the space of sculpture and that of performance. Ann engages with the poetics of the body in failing economies by making installations, spare organs and parts, and performative meals, a labor informed by decades of work in hospitals and county clinics. We see the gates of art as permeable and are intrepid in bringing our friends, families, other artists and total strangers along with us. We operate with a premise of mixing mediums, stretching possibilities and doing what it takes to enact ideas while following singular threads to the ends of the earth. Our work and biographies may be viewed at:
www.annschnake.com
www.elizabethdorbad.com 
http://unspeakableprojects.com/artists/elizabeth-dorbad/
 
Locations
This project’s nomadic trek will take us to three locations: the San Francisco Bay Area and the German cities of Berlin and Kassel.  We will begin in the Bay Area July 2012 and premiere in Berlin during the month of August with a gallery exhibition, choreographed artist dinners and pop-up events in public venues.  In late August, we will travel to Kassel to build a temporary installation and performance piece curated by the Critical Art Ensemble for dOCUMENTA(13). We are honored and delighted to intertwine the gustatory and the aesthetic as we become a part of the conversation, artistic production and ripple effect of dOCUMENTA(13) --this is a huge artistic endeavor for us! 
Artists formed the first documenta in 1955 as an action that represented the banishment of the cultural darkness of Nazism.  Now attended by over 750,000 visitors, documenta occurs every 5 years, and lasts for precisely 100 days; it is considered by many to be the most important exhibition and site for ideas in the contemporary art world. Every documenta has wrestled conceptually and politically with the issues of its times and historically has become a source for defining and revolutionizing contemporary culture. 
The Art!  
We are building a mobile installation and creating vignettes in various locations, from gallery to lecture hall to park, while bringing a five other artists into the mix. Imagine a visually evocative tent made of discarded materials, as installation, with props and characters to flesh out the scenario: wooden masks and limbs to create mobile identities; scrolls of essential questions such as recipes for potions to cure the ills of failing economies and social systems; a large tornado puppet that represents contemporary wilderness and upends order; soapboxes for standing on and walking over. 
Performance artists in Berlin will help us enact these characters, from a confused waitress playing a violin to a bureaucrat grilling customers for illuminating thoughts. In this whirling space, we will periodically serve empanadas and slivovitz in exchange for ideas and create an atmosphere that invites chewing over thoughts. We have chosen empanadas, as a quintessential nomadic food, convenient for a traveler’s pocket. Since we will be enacting the project as travelers ourselves, the view from the road gives us playful boldness to build inclusive creative acts on an international platform. We imagine our empanadas and other tarts as an opening to conversations and engagements, a magical agent of erosion to artistic, social, economic, and geographic boundaries. 
The Traveling Medicine Show is a mythologized tent, a mobile station, a symbol of the American Spring and of the people living on the borders of cities and economies worldwide. Early medicine shows hawked snake oil and ”Indian medicine” for curing ills, bringing ideas of the wild, magic and entertainment to the bored and the desperate of small towns. We will peddle the occult, cacophony and suggestion of the types of far reaching possibility that emerge from hurricanes and erratic weather systems, feminine wilderness, domestic kindness gone feral and good empanadas. 
We are particularly excited about our collaboration as a convergence of our interests in itinerant structures…both architectural and societal, economies run amuck, and the physicality of eating and performance  --all wrapped around the colorful social platforms of both café and traveling medicine show! 
 
What We Need & What You Get
By August 21st, we need to raise $8,000 to support the materials, travel, and logistics of this project, involving seven artists and thousands of viewers. Your  tax deductible contribution will support the making of sculpture, puppets, masks, a tent, a mobile cooking and serving unit and all the physical and performative elements of the Traveling Medicine Show. It will also support the airfare, train and other transport of the project along with support for our collaborators in Germany. Access to a kitchen and a studio will allow us to make sculptural pieces as well as hundreds of empanadas. In some instances there will be a charge for the food served, but the economy of a café where food is paid for with ideas offers a provocative platform; thus your donation will support a lively international discourse and a reimagining of value, exchange and property in dramatic economic times. 
As artists we are enchanted to make art and products directly related to these themes specifically for you, to show our appreciation for your contribution. From cakes to Joseph Beuys handkerchiefs to theater and disaster photographs to cast bronze sculpture, we see these products as a rich part of our artistic production and an interweaving of objects with ideas that symbolize this particular body of work.  If you are interested in purchasing art and you do not see it here, now would be an excellent and helpful(!) time to do this.  Please contact us if interested!
SEE IMAGES OF OUR PERKS IN THE ATTACHED GALLERY!
Other Ways You Can Help
Please pass the word to people you know and ask them to do the same!  More support = more performance possibility and further exchange between artists and viewers internationally. You can also help us by giving us ideas—what do you think are the most pressing and radical questions to ask artists today? Send us suggestions of questions to pose to viewers at dOCUMENTA(13). 
What Next? 
Traveling Medicine Show will return to the Bay Area in the Fall with a whole series of visuals, performances and meals informed by a rich international artistic conversation.

story:
Help Us Drop A YarnBomb on the MainPlace Mall in Santa Ana, CA

Please help us raise money for Hope University’s YarnBombing Project!  Hope University is a fine arts program for adults with intellectual disabilities located in Anaheim, California.

At Hope University, we love to knit and make things with our hands.  One of our instructors, Sandra Carter, is a yarnbomber from Long Beach, California.  This made us think… We thought about coming up with a project that would make an impact on the community, let us use our talents and abilities, and let us share those skills with others.  What could be more perfect than a giant, massive YARNBOMBING made by people with and without disabilities?!  We wanted to create a physical and visual representation of how we are all part of the whole, and together we weave a beautiful fabric.

What We Need & What You Get

We pitched our idea to the Orange County Community Foundation and OC Arts, and they liked it and gave us $7,500!  The project will be installed at the Westfield MainPlace Mall in Santa Ana the day before the VSA Festival (a festival that celebrates the contributions of artists with disabilities), and then will be presented to the public on the day of the Festival, April 20th, 2013.  Although we received the grant, we need to raise an additional $7,500 to cover the cost of outreaching to at least 10 other organizations who serve people with disabilities.

The money you give us will provide for the cost of teaching others, providing the tools and materials they need to participate, and much more!  It will also provide funding for the first phase of the creation of a documentary about this project by filmmaker, Stephanie Serna.

What you will get , besides some of our great artistic perks, is the great feeling that comes from knowing you helped to put a smile on the faces of hundreds of people, both with and without disabilities.

Other Ways You Can Help

Short on cash?  You can still help!  Here are a few ways:

  • Help us get the word out and make some noise about our campaign.
  • Don’t forget to use the Indiegogo share tools!
  • Send us some of your fiberart work so you can help our bomb reach its full potential.  Find out more at www.hopeu.org

story:
What is this?

In October 2011, Scott Elyard and I debuted a month-long First Friday art show at Modern Dwellers Chocolate Lounge in Anchorage, AK called "Dinosaurs and Robots". The show was an amazing success, thanks in part to being featured on BoingBoing and on Glendon Mellow's Symbiartic Blog. One of the pieces from the show was later selected by Scientific American for their Image of the Week for 22 January 2012, and was also picked up by the popular Tumblr blog "F*ck Yeah, Dinosaur Art!".

Since then, Scott and I have been working feverishly a new show called "Archosaurs and Automata" scheduled to open for the first "First Friday" of the new year, 4 January 2013, and to be held again at Modern Dwellers Chocolate Lounge (Midtown location) - however, we need your help to make this a reality!

What do you need and what's in it for me?

Scott and I had to move soon after the original "Dinosaurs and Robots" show from Anchorage, AK to Homer, AK - 250 miles to the south - in pursuit of employment. We are asking for contributions to help fund our travel expenses to and from the show and to cover our printing and material costs.

For your contributions, we have several "perks" available:

• $5 - a "grab bag" of 4 assorted postcards designed by Scott Elyard and myself

• $25 - Unframed 11x14" photo print of one of our pieces from the show, signed by Scott and myself.

• $50 - "Archosaurs and Automata" dual-sided t-shirt - featuring the Clockwork Carnivore mascot and show information.

• $75 - T-shirt, postcards, AND signed photo print

• $500 - Selected canvas print from the show, delivered to your door!

Everyone who gives to this campaign, regardless of amount, will also recieve a hand-written "thank you" postcard from the both of us, and you will be featured at our show in January on a list of contributors.

All proceeds, regardless of whether or not we reach our posted monetary goal, will go towards the art show and making it happen.

A few closing words...

We had such a great time putting on the "Dinosaurs and Robots" show last October. It was successful beyond anything we had done previously, thanks to Glendon Mellow and Bora Z. at Scientific American Blogs, and Maggie Koerth-Baker at BoingBoing, and through the kind financial help of my friend, Nick Casler.

We want to continue to share our strange and wonderful visions with you. Help us make this show at least 20% cooler!

Other Ways You Can Contribute

Share our campaign on your blog, Facebook, Twitter, or Google+ by using the social network sharing tools provided through IndieGoGo. We also accept songs sung on the street corner, notes via carrier pigeon, or mentions at your next bar mitzvah as acceptable means of spreading the word about our campaign and our show.

story:
Who am I?

My name is Ben Clarkson and I am an award winning and beloved young artist from Winnipeg Canada. Last year I had a vision in the shower. This vision showed me a world where you could have my art, cheap, and without leaving your house. All I would ask for in exchange was the funds to keep creating said art and to mount progressively more ambitious projects and exhibitions of my work.


What is it?

Every month for a year I will send you one art postcard. Limited edition. Signed and numbered. That image will never be reprinted. You can frame them. You can put them on your fridge. You can throw them away. 
My subscribers from last years campaign loved them, so I am doing it again.  


All I really need is your name and address. You get them for a year, and it's awesome.

I am also including the option of buying my fundraising zines this year "A surprising book" and "Books are neat. Sometimes". They are 30 pages each and contain my minimal cartoons. Also? Laughs.


How will I use this money?

For 45 dollars you get 12 prints over the year. 5"x3.5" from the best print shop I can find. I then use that money to help me with my large scale drawing installations, specifically my major upcoming solo show at Les Territoires in Montreal.

story:
MY NEW GOAL IS TO RAISE $1,000 BY DECEMBER 1ST!!!

THIS WILL HELP ME OUT GREATLY IN GETTING MY ART ON CANVAS AND HOLDING MY ART SHOW WHICH WILL DIRECTLY RAISE FUNDS FOR MY NON-PROFIT ORGANIZATION, AS WELL AS ALLOW ME TO PRODUCE MORE PRODUCTS WITH MY ART WHICH AGAIN WILL BENEFIT THE TEENS THROUGH SAVING THE ART IN KIDS' SOULS!!

**ANY PLEDGE OF $10 or MORE WILL ALSO RECEIVE A PRINT OF MY ARTWORK, WHICH YOU WILL GET TO CHOOSE OUT OF 15-20 DESIGNS**

PLEDGE. SHARE. SUPPORT. THANK YOU!

 

Saving The Art in Kids' Souls

This campaign means the world to me!

With your help, I will be able to raise enough money and take my first steps to living out my dreams by having my very own art show in December 2012 which will directly benefit my mentoring group for teenagers where they can be exposed to the arts by attending a variety of arts and music events around the city on a regular basis.

As a high school teacher in Philadelphia for over 5 years, I was surrounded by teenagers that had so much talent and creativity in their souls but not enough resources and support to develop their skills in order to take them to the next level. I also spoke to many teens who told me stories about what went on after-school and during the weekends in their communities and how many of them had to stay in the house to stay safe and out of trouble. They were sort of like prisoners in their homes, sometimes left alone or to watch younger siblings, only to be entertained by tv or the internet. And many times I could see the dreams in their souls slowly fading away. I cannot, and will not, stand by and watch their dreams die! And neither should you.  

Saving The Art in Kids' Souls will eventually be a non-profit organization, a community center where teens can come after-school, on weekends, and during the summer to stay out of trouble, be creative, be successful, and achieve their dreams. Please help me take the first step in supporting our young people and help me to save the art in their souls by making a pledge and spreading the word to everyone you know! StaskinStudios thanks you for your support!

Did You Know?

Did you know that arts and music programs are being cut in schools across the city and nation? This is a travesty and it is one of the main reasons I am starting a mentoring group for teenagers involving the arts. The arts help to build creativity, problem-solving skills, and higher-order thinking skills in teenagers. And mentoring programs help teens to develop positive relationships with peers and adults while keeping them off the streets and out of trouble. Saving The Art in Kids' Souls will provide teens with access to caring adults while enriching their lives through the arts. 

Who Are You? A Tale Of Two Loves

I am Shannon, also known as Staks, and I am a former high school teacher and an artist/photographer from Abington, Pa. a suburb outside of Philadelphia. When I was 10 years old I decided I wanted to be a teacher and I never veered off of that path until I resigned from teaching 3 years ago. At the same time I decided to be a teacher I would be at home setting up my dolls and toys for "photo shoots" and begging my mom to buy me black and white film. I tried to stay on both paths but somehow made a turn away from art. But your heart always brings you back to your true love and so StaskinStudios was born. My passion for art and photography grew stronger with the digital age but a part of me still missed the young people. So I decided to join my two passions together and here we are!

About The Art

I create music-inspired art and photography. I get a creative vision in my mind, I set up a photo shoot using everyday objects as well as elements from the musical world (I use lots of vinyl records!), take the picture, then alter it digitally using Photoshop until I get the look and feel of the art that I saw in my mind. My paintings are a fusion of art, music, and life. They are joyful and full of soul and I know that you will love them!

Why An Indiegogo Campaign?

I'm like Diddy but without the money or the people. Diddy is an "idea man". Love him or hate him, he has great ideas. I'm an idea woman. And now with Indiegogo I have the people (all of you!) and you have the money (or know people who do!). I have so many creative ideas to make really cool art for you all to enjoy and I have tons of ideas to help the young people in Philly be successful. I believe that Indiegogo is a great way to get people together for great causes and to help each other achieve our dreams!

I have 1,100 facebook friends. If every friend gave just $4.55 to my campaign, I will reach my goal! OR if 200 people pledge $25, I will reach my goal! It's really not that much money if you have a lot of friends... so please be my friend and make your friends be my friend too! And don't forget...

WHEN YOU GIVE, YOU ALSO GET.

You will receive fabulous perks as a THANK YOU for your donation, as well as that awesome feeling you get when you make a difference in someone's life and they love you forever! Because...

 I. WILL. LOVE. YOU. FOREVER. 

                                                                                                           

If I do not reach my goal (which is silly because I plan on surpassing it wth all of your help!) then I will still keep whatever funds I raise, you will still receive your perks, and I will still have an art show and follow my dreams.... but I may have to take on extra soul-sucking jobs that will leave me with no time, no energy, and no joy to fulfill my passions and make a difference in the wonderful ways I know I can! (Not to make you feel bad or anything.. )

What Will The Money Be Used For?

My goal is to raise $5,000 in 40 Days. This is the absolute minimum needed.

4% goes to Indiegogo if I reach or surpass my goal. 9% if I don't reach it.

15% goes to the Thank You PERKS

20% goes to S.T.A.K.S. mentoring group

40% goes to getting my art put on canvas for the art show

15-20% goes to renting space for art show, marketing and promotions, misc.

**If I surpass my goal then I can give you more fabulous perks, I can give more money to my mentoring group, I can make more art, and buy some much needed art/photo equipment that I do not have.**

ALSO, 20% OF ALL MY ART/PHOTO SALES FROM HERE ON OUT WILL GO DIRECTLY TO MY MENTORING GROUP. SO PLEASE SUPPORT THE YOUNG PEOPLE!

Ways You Can Help

1) You can contribute funds and receive cool perks. Every dollar counts!

2) You can spread the word to your friends, family, co-workers, and random people you meet on the street!

3) Share my link on facebook, twitter, your blog, everywhere!

 

PAYMENT ACCEPTED- feel safe and secure and using Paypal or a Credit Card. If you wish to send a money order or personal check please contact me at staskinstudios@gmail.com.

Remember that every dollar counts and you can give ANY amount you wish even if it is not listed on the perks and you will receive the perk that falls just below your contribution amount. Thank you!

 

 

$5,000 in 40 Days....

WE CAN DO IT TOGETHER!! I BELIEVE IN YOU, ME, AND THE TEENAGERS!


P.S. FUN FACT

Where did the name S.T.A.K.S. come from? I see it everywhere!

Well... Staks is actually my nickname. It is a play on my last name, Staskin, and friends and students used to see me working hard (and STACKING my cash) years ago to make more money and I was always making plans for my art so the name was created and it just stuck! It's catchy and interesting and so more and more people started calling me Staks, and I love it! Then, a few months ago, the English teacher inside of me saw an acronym in my nickname when I was thinking of a name for my youth mentoring group. It came so quickly and it was exactly what my vision for the mentoring group was... Saving The Art in Kids' Souls. I took it as a sign to move forward with my dreams and so that's what I'm doing! Right now!  

PLEASE HELP ME ROCK THIS INDIEGOGO CAMPAIGN!!

Pledge money OR Share my link OR do both!!

I will love you forever!! 

Thanks again friends!!

 

Share my link please! www.indiegogo.com/iamstaks

20% goes to S.T.A.K.S. mentoring group
40% goes to getting my art put on canvas for the art show
15-20% goes to renting space for art show, marketing and promotions, misc.
**If I surpass my goal then I can give you more fabulous perks, I can give more money to my mentoring group, I can make more art, and buy some much needed art/photo equipment that I do not have.**
ALSO, 20% OF ALL MY ART/PHOTO SALES FROM HERE ON OUT WILL GO DIRECTLY TO MY MENTORING GROUP. SO PLEASE SUPPORT THE YOUNG PEOPLE!
Ways You Can Help
1) You can contribute funds and receive cool perks. Every dollar counts!
2) You can spread the word to your friends, family, co-workers, and random people you meet on the street!
3) Share my link on facebook, twitter, your blog, everywhere!
 
PAYMENT ACCEPTED- feel safe and secure and using Paypal or a Credit Card. If you wish to send a money order or personal check please contact me at staskinstudios@gmail.com.
Remember that every dollar counts and you can give ANY amount you wish even if it is not listed on the perks and you will receive the perk that falls just below your contribution amount. Thank you!
 

 
$5,000 in 40 Days....
WE CAN DO IT TOGETHER!! I BELIEVE IN YOU, ME, AND THE TEENAGERS!

P.S. FUN FACT
Where did the name S.T.A.K.S. come from? I see it everywhere!
Well... Staks is actually my nickname. It is a play on my last name, Staskin, and friends and students used to see me working hard (and STACKING my cash) years ago to make more money and I was always making plans for my art so the name was created and it just stuck! It's catchy and interesting and so more and more people started calling me Staks, and I love it! Then, a few months ago, the English teacher inside of me saw an acronym in my nickname when I was thinking of a name for my youth mentoring group. It came so quickly and it was exactly what my vision for the mentoring group was... Saving The Art in Kids' Souls. I took it as a sign to move forward with my dreams and so that's what I'm doing! Right now!  
PLEASE HELP ME ROCK THIS INDIEGOGO CAMPAIGN!!
Pledge money OR Share my link OR do both!!
I will love you forever!! 
Thanks again friends!!
 
Share my link please! www.indiegogo.com/iamstaks

story:
Our Story


Paper Kingdom is the fourth in a series of experimental small press and mixed media events organized by Sharon Alexander and sponsored by the Wayward Music Series, at Wallingford’s historic Good Shepherd Center in the Chapel.

Handsome self-published and crafted things
Live music in bursts and moments
Aural textures
Classic, obscure and reputed reads
Other nebulous surprises
Paper and oranges

Thursday August 11, 6pm-9pm
$5 - $15 donation encouraged

Artists Include:

Garek Druss                
Traci Eggleston
Martine Workman        
Jason T. Miles
Tony Remple               
James Yeary
Nate Orton                   
Andrew Bleeker
Tyler Holm                   
Kelly Bjork
Sharon Alexander        
Karl Seng
Ezra Mark                    
Arrington de Dionyso
Duane Edmonds          
Paul Killebrew
Marshall Langohr         
Hart Boyd
David Hrivnak               
Jacques Shaver
John Teske


The Impact


As we extend our support to small press and independent experiments in publishing and ephemera, we also attempt an aesthetic mix of the art of the moment. We borrow and cultivate the art and artists influencing us currently; the impact of such a process is always fresh, always varied.
Our process serves and exemplifies the visions and choices of alternative doing and making.

What We Need & What You Get


We need to cover our expenses, which are primarily day calls for technical assistance—lights, sound board, sound designs, set-up/strike, agent tabling and door/admissions. Additional underwriting we’ll use to pay for our supplies, including film and paper. We structure intended compensation along the lines of day stipends with priority given to technical assistance and facilitation of our core production values.
We definitively raise people’s labor over the acquisition of stuff!
With your donation you will receive an admissions voucher to Paper Kingdom along with a CD mix of collaborating friends’ music (originally a companion to the small press project Fragments). Packaged by hand with attention and care, the CD includes tracks by Marefumi Komura, Gretta Harley directing the Seattle Chamber Players, Climax Golden Twins, and a rare banjo solo by Jeffery Taylor.
For our voucher/CD incentive we ask for a minimum donation of $15.
You also receive our sincere appreciation and thanks.

Other Ways You Can Help


We like reasonable volunteers. We also plan to present and serve oranges, tangerines, tangelos, etc., between media presentations. Consider bringing organic citrus fruit to share on August 11.
Thank you.

story:
About Me

For the last 10 years my work has been about how to remove the viewer from his/hers reality so they can in turn view it from a distance and re-examine their world from a different point of view.  

I am a strong believer that one of the many roles of an artist is to bring the viewer outside of their everyday world by either creating new ideas or concepts for the viewer to climb into or by putting the viewer into the artists life by creating work the discusses the life of the artist.

To create my work  I  have been known to use a combination of identity art that talks about my life as a person with a disability , complex rules and regulations for either myself or others to construct a work by and/or purposely absurd works that remove the viewer from reality. 

for my next show I would like to explorre the layering of information and synbols that we encounter in our everyday lives. 

 

What I need


i need 10 5ft by 4ft canvases. each canvas will cost me 100 dollars each. 

i will also need around 50 dollars worth of acrylic paint each month.

plus i will need around another 250 dollars worth of miscellaneous supplies

 

What you get


for a small donation of 25 dollars you will get a small 8 by 10 inch water color or drawing

for a donation of 120 you will get a 8 by 10inch painting on canvas.

for a 600 dolar donation you will get all of the above and a 4 square ft painting on canvas

Other Ways You Can Help

you can make micro-donations of anything you can afford

you can pass the word or you can help me pick up the canvases.

story:
Who are we?

The Inconvenience is a community of interdisciplinary artists who create collaborative events by  mixing music, theatre, dance, fine art and celebration. Through producing, curating and original development, these events activate audience and artist exchange to create social dialogue.

Why do we do it?

Working together brings out the best in all of us. We encourage artists and audience to reach across the aisle and connect while we provide the best quality conditions possible for success.

  • We are dedicated to providing competitive wages to artists for thier work.
  • We provide high quality support for the collaborations we foster. This means state of the art equipment, safe rehearsal and workshop environments, administrative and marketing support, innovative design teams and professional management personnel.
  • We are committed to making art accessible through controlled ticket prices and accessible environments. 

What is next?

  • We are prepared to take the next step as an organization and deepen our roots in Chicago's cultural landscape.
  • We're changing our administrative structure and have joined behind our new Artistic Director: Missi Davis
  • We have our most epic year yet: Season 2015

Why do we need your help?

Ticket prices cover about a third of what it costs to provide these services to our audience and artists. Every dollar goes directly into the events that we bring you, and this year we lay the ground plan for the future. These funds will also support us while we:

  • Build relationships with foundations for grant support to seek out sustainable general operations funding.
  • Find a space of our own to provide the community with a center for collaboration.
  • Build new partnerships with other arts and community organizations to connect networks and strengthen the voice of Chicago.
  • Build a youth and mentor-ship program for emerging artists.

    Can't donate? You can still help!

    Hey -- We're artists and we TOTALLY understand if you are not able to  make a contribution, but if you like what you see here, then spreading the word about THE INCONVENIENCE is just as helpful for us! Sharing our campaign with your friends and family goes a long way -- or just find us on your favorite social media and give us a "like". 


    See Something. Start Something.

story: ...

Our Story

We have been interns with the North Carolina Art Therapy Institute since September, namely working twice a week in local schools with refugee children and autistic children. We have both learned a whole whole lot, namely that we both want to pursue expressive arts therapy as a career. Brian will be applying to Lesley University and Kaitlin will be applying to Appalachian State University for the fall of 2012. 

Do you know about expressive arts therapy? It is the jam. The International Expressive Arts Therapy Association defines expressive arts as the following:

The expressive arts combine the visual arts, movement, drama, music, writing and other creative processes to foster deep personal growth and community development. IEATA encourages an evolving multimodal approach within psychology, organizational development, community arts and education. By integrating the arts processes and allowing one to flow into another, we gain access to our inner resources for healing, clarity, illumination and creativity.

Cool right?! While we are so pumped about applying to graduate school for this amazing field in 2012, we are too eager and passionate and excited to wait that long, so we are raising funds to go to this conference in Lima, Peru!!

International Expressive Arts Therapy Association
9th Biennial International Conference

How amazing does that look?!!?

The Impact

We know this will be an extraordinary opportunity to learn more about the field and make connections with professionals from all over the world. There are so many workshops and events during the 4 days that we dont even know what to choose!! Needless to say, we are PUMPED about this conference and all that we have to learn. Upon returning to North Carolina we both hope to implement what we learn in our current jobs and expressive arts endeavors (i.e. Kaitlin will help lead a prenatal expressive arts workshop!). We also hope that this will give us a leg up on getting into grad school!

We are going no matter what,

 but the realities of spending this much money are rather daunting.

Oh my. 

THEREFORE:


What We Need 


AIRFARE = $500+ each roundtrip from Miami (and we have to get to Miami too)

CONFERENCE = $370 combined

ACCOMMODATION IN LIMA= approximately $35 each per night, as we want to stay as close to the site of the conference as possible. We need the nights of August 9-14, 6 nights total, which is $420

FOOD= we will need our strength!! $30 a day for both of us for 5 days = $150

EMERGENCY FUND = $60 for those little unavoidable costs that come with traveling abroad

Equaling a nice even total of $2,000!

THAT IS SO DO-ABLE.

What You Get

*Updates on our blog:

 kaitlinandbrianinperu.blogspot.com


*honest-to-goodness-heartfelt-GRATITUDE from us


*awesome karma


Other Ways You Can Help

SHARE OUR DREAM!!

Send this link on! Post it on facebook, twitter, whatever. Wow. 

That would be so incredible if you actually did that. 


THANK YOU for reading all this. You are amazing. We really appreciate your help and support in this dream. 


LOVE AND ART!!!

Kaitlin and Brian

story:
CAN YOU IMAGINE A GROVE OF TREES STANDING ON A RIVER ?

"Winter Garden" is a temporary site specific art installation for the frozen Assiniboine Credit Union River Trail, at Winnipeg, Manitoba, Canada - an artificial grove that will be installed inside the ice layers. 

"Winter Garden" is a place for play and pause between the trees, an open playground along the skating trail for the people of Winnipeg.

This artificial grove will create a surrealistic, surprising and picturesque scene, emphasizing the transformation of water into solid ground at winter times. 


WHO

We are Roy and Noa from Tel Aviv, Israel. We are both architects, but side by side with our architectural endeavors we also work on art projects and installations, primarily ones that engage and impact the public space. Last year we won the 2011 "Warming Huts - Art + Architecture competition on ice", where we designed and built the "Woodpile", a unique shelter for the Assiniboine Credit Union River Trail, the world's longest natural skating trail in the city of Winnipeg, Canada.


For us, living in the never ending summer of the Middle East, the snowy landscape of Canada and walking on ice for the first time in our lives was an overwhelming experience. Deeply inspired by that, we came up with an idea for the "Winter Garden" project.


HOW

Winter Garden will be placed on the frozen Assiniboine Credit Union River Trail. It will be a public event - a place for stop and play for the thousands of visitors skating along the trail.

The installation will be comprised of 16 trees that will be organized in a grid pattern, resembling an artificial grove. Each tree is to be put in a hole that will be drilled in the ice and held with a special ring that will fix it in position.

We intend to make re-use of dead trees for the installation. By that we use the trees once again in their natural form in order to create a unique landscape for the benefit of Winnipeg's public space and reduce the project's ecological footprint.



WHEN

Winter Garden is planned to be installed together with this year's new warming huts at the end of January 2012, which is really soon!


YOU HAVE AN OPPORTUNITY

We contacted "The Forks Foundation" which operates and maintains the river trail, and they enthusiastically gave their support for realizing the project, but cannot take over the entire costs of the installation.

That's where you have an opportunity in making this vision of Winter Garden a reality together with us! We are trying to raise another $5000 which should cover most of the expenses. You can contribute according to each of the categories written on the upper right side of this page, and to be rewarded accordingly. Another great thing you can do for Winter Garden is help us reach as many people as possible by sending this to everyone you know.


THANK YOU FOR YOUR COLLABORATION !

SEE YOU AT WINTER GARDEN !

story:
A Little Bit About Phoenix WOWPS Rep:

Roanna Shaundiin Shebala, aka Rowie Shebala, a Native American Spoken word poet from Fort Defiance, AZ, (7 miles north of the Capital of the Navajo Nation, Window Rock, AZ) is trying to find her way to Minneapolis, Minnesota to compete in the Women of the World Poetry Slam (WOWPS). WOWPS is a national poetry slam event where women from all over the country and Canada will be representing their poetry scene. After winning The Women of Phoenix Poetry Slam, she was honored to represent Phoenix Slam at this prestigious event. Though poetry is her passion she needs help getting to the competition. This is where you lovely people can help.

 

Asking for Your Help

Please help me by donating to my fundraising campaign. I need to get to the Women of the World Poetry slam in Minneapolis, Minnesota from March 7-10, 2013. This will be covering my; plane tickets, hotel room, transportation (cab fare, bus tickets etc), and food.

How Your Money Will Help

I know when you're putting your money out there you would want to know where it is going, so here is a break down on what your generosity will be going towards.

Break down in more detail:

  • Airplane Ticket: $500+
  • Hotel Room: $404.85
  • Food estimate: $120
  • Transportation (cab fare, bus tickets, etc.): $90

Hope for the best and prepare for the unexpected is what I have always been taught. My estimate for this trip is about $1,120.

Whatever help I receive will be going towards me getting to WOWPS, in Minneapolis, Minnesota.

Info on the Poet

The first time I could remember writing poetry and enjoying the art was my sophomore year in high school. Since then I have been writing trying to grow and strengthen with my poetry, as well as my performance. In 2004 is when I first attended my first poetry slam in Flagstaff, AZ. I had no idea that poetry was turned into a sport where scores were given, performance and writing was judged, and most importantly the audience was involved. Later that year is when I first stepped on a stage and performed my first poem at a Poetry Slam. I remember being so scared that you could hear the paper as I shook on stage. After overcoming the fear of public speaking I have enjoyed my time performing my poetry on stage. Since then I have been on the 2011, and 2012 National Team, and this is my first year representing my venue at Women of the World Poetry Slam.

From the time in Flagstaff, AZ, I have moved to Phoenix Arizona, and have been a host, organizer, advocate, and poet to the Poetry scene here in my city. Poetry is part of my identity. So being able to represent Phoenix at the Women of the World Poetry Slam, I find this a great blessing in my life.

How Else Can You Help

I know there are times in everyone’s life where they have no money to help, but want to help, so what you can do is spread the word about my campaign. Send them this link, and let everyone you know, know. Thank you so much for your support.

story:
WE FIGHT AGAINST BANK-TERROR There are presidental elections next year and we need some additional funds to support our anti-eviction campaign.

Human blockade (Živi zid) is Croatian non-profit and independent NGO against evictions. We gather activists who prevent evictions by forming human shield. We believe that right on housing is one of basic human rights. If bank, tax office or corrupt legal system want to take away your home and you have lost all other legal measures be free to contact us. Same is in case you want to take part in our actions.

In 7 years we have increase of enforced real estates for 2 100 %.

Association for protection and assistance to victims of evictions - STOP THE EVICTIONS
This is the Manifesto of conscience, intended for everyone.
It does not call for a revolution, but it definitely calls for a search for the truth and awakening of people’s conscience. To reach the concept of conscience, it is necessary to understand the truth. While human does not understand the truth, it cannot even talk about the conscience. Truth can be both beautiful and ugly.

Unfortunately today, the ruling political options are organized in such a way that their primary goal is to satisfy their own needs, and for the people and the citizens do not care.

Criminally set financial system and occupied monetary authorities, through interest rates have taken their toll. Policy, which should serve the people, they turned to their own business caring only for their own benefit.

Living beings have their needs. One needs the soil in which to live because they cannot live in water. He needs air because without it his dying brain, but after a few minutes.

Man requires air, because after a few minutes, his brain is dying.

Besides, he needs water, because it cannot survive without it for more than two or three days. Man also needs food because it would die after a few weeks or months without altering substances and energy supply. He needs shelter in which to hide from adversity and danger. Some place where they can defend themselves.

People are such creatures that have a natural biological need to have a shelter, a house and a home. Civilization, which is no civilization at all, has gone in the wrong direction and started to impoverish its 99% by taking their homes. Tent settlement are rising as well as number of people the banks have evicted. In Croatia, a real flood of evictions is yet to take place as the crisis is getting worse. The civilization is collapsing on itself by following some laws, some illogical procedures of ignorant idiots. It is collapsing on itself because it destroys its primary purpose, which is to meet human needs - such as the right to a home. It is a natural right, biological and cultural rights and it is above artificial, man-made rights of corrupted bureaucrat.

My home surpasses your property.

Biological - cultural right at home is above the mafia right to property.

It is your own decision about how much you can use these words and how much, in the end, will you participate in the creation of the truth.

Our organisation named Human blokade is taking care of the people who have lost everything  because of corruption or poor economic situation in the country.  The poor economic situation is caused by credit crisis which led to the state in which many credits cannot be payed back. Hit by corruption and unemployment from one side and uncollectible loans from the other many have lost their homes and even more are in danger of losing them. We deal with families that have eviction problems.

Many would say that the inability to pay a loan is a personal problem and that people are to be blamed. This could be truth ten years ago when this problem was not so common but not now when it hits hundreds of thousands of people in four million population of Croatia. It is a problem of the system, financial system, that is.

Our cases include frauds and legal absurdity, a very spread industry in Croatian judiciary, local government and tycoon operations. It shall not pass on our watch. Our job is solidarity and if one word is to be chosen to describe our organisation it is solidarity.

If the system stays blind and deaf on our demands and whistling on injustice we use our mighty weapon – civil disobedience and peaceful sabotage of evictions with simultaneously alerting the press and media houses. That is right, everything we ever did was recorded.

story:
Comment procéder pour acheter un t-shirt ?

1- . En haut de la photo, visitez la galerie et les 9 photos de t-shirt  pour bien choisir votre modèle et votre couleur. Nous vous contacterons pour le format. 

2-  Cliquez ensuite sur la case en rouge. CONTRIBUER MAINTENANT. 

3- Une nouvelle page s'ouvre, cliquez, DEMANDER UNE CONTREPARTIE ,  pour ouvrir le choix de t-shirt et faire un choix. 

4-  Se connecter via Facebook

5- Laissez vos coordonnés pour la livraison. 

6-  Payez par carte de crédit ou par Paypal. 

La vente prend fin le 31 mars prochain. Les t-shirts vous seront livrés quelques jours plus tard, et les bénéfices s’il y en a - ce qui n’est pas certain - serviront à payer de la publicité Facebook pour accroître la visibilité de la page. Merci de votre confiance.

 S'il y a erreur, que vous oubliez de demander votre contrepartie, c.-à-d. de faire le choix de votre t-shirt, ou autre problème, contactez-moi pour m'expliquer : leclerc.ri @hotmail.com


Ce dont nous avons besoin et ce que vous obtenez

IL NE S'AGIT PAS D'UNE CAMPAGNE DE LEVER DE FONDS. Il s'agit ici de prendre vos commandes pour un achat groupé de t-shirt. Plus le nombre de t-shirts est élevé plus il est possible de les obtenir à meilleur coût. Puisqu'il faut fixer un montant minimum de 500 $ dollars pour utiliser cette plateforme, c'est le montant que j'ai fixé. Possiblement que ce montant ne sera pas atteint et par conséquent, une charge de 9% des dons ou vente sera conservée par Indiegogo. S'il reste des bénéfices, ceux-ci serviront à faire de la publicité sur Facebook pour améliorer la visibilité de la page et de ses publications. 

L'impact

Bien entendu, plus nous serons nombreux à arborer le logo de la page, plus celle-ci profitera d'une visibilité susceptible d'accroître son auditoire. 

Risques et défis

Quel que soit le nombre de t-shirts vendu par cette plate-forme, chacun de vous recevra comme prévu dès le début d'avril 2015 le ou les t-shirts (s)  tels que commandé et payé.  Promis.

Acheter un t-shirt sans passer par cette plate-forme 

C’est possible. Notez par contre que cela vous coûtera plus cher. Le chandail bio vous coûtera 24.03 $ taxe comprise , ajouter les frais de livraison. Le chandail fabriqué au Québec vous coûtera 36.79 $ taxe comprise, ajouter les frais de livraison. Voir ce lien pour le fournisseur. https://www.originalboutik.com/fr

story:
I’m Mia Araujo, and I create fantastical, mythological portraits of women. I believe that we humans have a deep connection with nature and the cosmos, so I strive to rekindle that connection in everyday people with my art.

As most of you know, I work a restaurant job by day, and create art by night. Turning 30 this year has gotten me thinking about my dreams, and especially those that I’ve left on the back-burner. So I’ve decided to start this new era by going for one of my biggest dreams- which is to show at my first convention, WonderCon 2017!

I work traditionally, and there is nothing quite like seeing original art in person. I’m alone in my studio when I create this work, but the art I make isn’t just for me. It’s for anyone who needs a little spark of magic in their lives. So I’m very excited about the opportunity that conventions have to offer!

And here is why I need your help to get there:

Every artist’s first convention is the most difficult and the most expensive. There are a lot of upfront costs. But after that first hurdle, all future conventions will go much more smoothly. I've been attending conventions as a fan for the last 4 years, but now I’m ready to get out there and be an exhibitor myself.

My plan is to...

*Start with WonderCon (Anaheim, March 2017) because it’s local, and it gives me enough time to finish my current body of work.

*Start out offering prints, postcards, and small originals, to gain experience managing a booth before expanding to more items, larger art, and flying to different cities.

*Make each convention appearance unique, by offering a different limited-edition hand-painted mask design that will only be available to attendees of that show. I have a ton of designs that I have been accumulating in my sketchbooks, and can’t wait to bring them into the real world!

*Create other convention-only items such as limited-edition pendants, hand-pulled gocco prints, and hand-embellished prints.

*Use this as a platform to unveil my newest body of work.

*Bring my experience of showing at galleries to the convention floor, creating a body of work that pulls people in, and designing a booth that creates a magical ambience for viewers.

All funds raised will go towards:

*Booth fees (which vary from show to show),

*Banner and other display equipment (a one-time cost for the first show, which can then be used in all future shows)

*Printed inventory such as prints, postcards, etc. (Printing larger amounts upfront saves money, and can be used for future shows as well).

*Indiegogo’s 8-10% cut, and taxes- inevitably a portion of funds raised will go towards taxes and fees involved with running this campaign.

Any extra funds (stretch goals) raised will go towards:

*Booth fees at future conventions!

*More elaborate printed items, such as sketchbook, catalogues, and art books!

*Out-of-town convention expenses (airfare, hotel, shipping costs)- would you like to meet me and see my work in person at a convention near you? Here are just a few conventions I've set my sights on for the future: CTNx (Los Angeles), APE (San Francisco), Emerald City Con (Seattle), MoCCA Fest (New York), C2E2 (Chicago), DragonCon (Atlanta), IlluxCon (Pennsylvania).

 

REWARDS:

I’ve created some unique rewards for those of you who choose to help me on my journey!
These are backer-only items that will not be available after this campaign comes to an end- so get them while you can! Each reward is hand-touched by me in some capacity, whether it’s signed, hand-embellished, or hand-painted. I’ve also put a lot of time and love into making some physical artifacts from my world, to add a little more magic in your world :)

If you can’t contribute at this time, please share this campaign with your friends and with anyone whom you think would enjoy my work.

Thank you guys so much for supporting me over the years, and for helping me reach my dream as I embark on this new era of my life!

Mia xxx

REWARD TIERS:

If you would like more than one reward, I can combine shipping! However Indiegogo does not currently allow for multiple reward tiers in one transaction. So please make separate contributions for each reward that you would like, and private message me to receive a shipping refund :)


Each mask comes with a 4" x 6" postcard of the costume sketch that inspired the design.

story:
Find Us


Who we are

Falmouth University has an internationally acclaimed reputation for creative excellence. As an institute it is home to some of the country's most exciting artistic talent. It is a fantastic environment for collaboration and communication. 

We are a group of third year students from a variety of courses and we are putting together an exhibition to take to London. Over the past year we have been putting on pop-up exhibitions around Falmouth. Each time we have occupied a new space from a recording studio to a garage to a bar and our aim is always to create an interesting environment where people and artists can get together and experience art in a social environment. 

What we are doing

On the 13th - 15th of June we will be occupying The Rag Factory Nr Bricklane in London. With sculptures, photography, painting, illustration, enthusiasm, creativity, drawing, character and originality we'd like to create an exhibition which is something to remember. 

How you can help

We are beginning to curate our show and we have lots of ideas about how we can make this show special. But most importantly at the moment we need to raise the money for our deposit. £400 will cover the deposit for the space for the 3 days. We are also looking to raise a further £100 to support our fundraising events. Over the next few months we will be hosting a number of fundraising events from pop-up exhibitions to gig nights around Falmouth. 

In return for a donation you will be added to our mailing list and receive a private invitation to all of our fundraising events. You will also be invited to the private view of our exhibition in London in June.

story:
WOW! Thank you everyone that helped us reach $1000! As mentioned below, any extra money we raise will fill in funding gaps (if we fall short on other predicted sources of funds) and go toward future events. We are laying out the following STRETCH GOALS:

$1500 -- the team will upload a daily video blog of our experiences at the National Poetry Slam, Aug 5-9

$2000 -- we GUARANTEE that we'll bring in some of the best poets we can find to be featured in AT LEAST 10 of the 12 poetry open mics in 2014-2015.


our mission

give everyone a voice build community
grow as poets & people hold awesome arts events


In line with this mission, we currently have two monthly events: 

1) a poetry open mic, where the focus is on having a supportive place for people to share their poetry, and 

2) a poetry slam, where poets bring out their strongest writing and do their best to engage with the audience.

[What's a poetry slam?]

Each year, we send a team to the National Poetry Slam.

[What's the National Poetry Slam?]

This year's team consists of Rachel, Bryan, Tiff, Adam, and Kelly. Look at how cute we are!

Sending our team to NPS means a few things:

1) Our region will be represented at the national level

2) These five community members (three of whom have never competed on a team at NPS before) will grow tremendously as poets, both in the preparation for NPS and through their experiences in Oakland -- and will bring those experiences back to our scene

3) We'll have more access with the national poetry scene, providing us access to potential featured poets and workshop leaders

how to get involved

donate

We need your help!

come to our events

We have poetry events every month -- to find out more, check us out on facebook,meetup, or shoot us an e-mail.

    funding goal: $1000

    [Why $1000?]

    The funds raised in this campaign will go towards covering the cost of the team's flight and hotel expenses!  If our other funding sources come through, any money raised in excess of our target will go toward paying for workshops and featured poets in our 2014-2015 season.

    SPECIAL GOALS:

    when we reach...

    $1000, the top ten funders will each get a personalized thank-you video!

    $1500, the team will upload a daily video log while we're in Oakland so you can experience NPS vicariously through us!

    [What do the shirts look like?]
    [What's a chapbook?]




    [What's a poetry slam?]

    A poetry slam is a performance poetry competition. Poets take turns performing original poetry. Arbitrarily-selected members of the audience then judge their writing, delivery, and originality.  High-scoring poets are invited back up to the stage to share more of their work.

    We have our poetry slams for a couple of reasons -- 1), they get 35+ people to come out for poetry on a Saturday night in Rockland County; 2) they challenge/motivate poets to hone both their writing and their delivery.

    [What's the National Poetry Slam?]

    Basically, summer camp for poets.

    The National Poetry Slam (NPS) is a week-long event that occurs each August. 72 four- or five-member poetry teams from all over North America (and sometimes other parts of the world) get together for workshops, readings, networking, 2-AM-sidewalk-poetry, etc. The 72 teams compete over four nights in a series of 4-team bouts until one team is declared the champion.

    It's probably one of the most challenging and inspiring experiences a poet can have. 

    [Why $1000?]


    Airfare: ~ $3000 
    Lodging: ~ $1000
    Total costs: ~ $4000 

    Funds raised from slams this year: ~ $2000
    Expected fundraising from June-August events: ~ $1000
    Total raised from other sources: ~$3000

    [What do the shirts look like?]

    I'm SO GLAD you asked! 



    [What's a chapbook?]
    A chapbook is a small book of poetry. In our case, we self-published it at Staples. Our chapbook contains 3 poems from each of our 5 team members.

The funds raised in this campaign will go towards covering the cost of the team's flight and hotel expenses!  If our other funding sources come through, any money raised in excess of our target will go toward paying for workshops and featured poets in our 2014-2015 season.SPECIAL GOALS:when we reach...$1000, the top ten funders will each get a personalized thank-you video!$1500, the team will upload a daily video log while we're in Oakland so you can experience NPS vicariously through us![What do the shirts look like?][What's a chapbook?][What's a poetry slam?]A poetry slam is a performance poetry competition. Poets take turns performing original poetry. Arbitrarily-selected members of the audience then judge their writing, delivery, and originality.  High-scoring poets are invited back up to the stage to share more of their work.We have our poetry slams for a couple of reasons -- 1), they get 35+ people to come out for poetry on a Saturday night in Rockland County; 2) they challenge/motivate poets to hone both their writing and their delivery.[What's the National Poetry Slam?]Basically, summer camp for poets.The National Poetry Slam (NPS) is a week-long event that occurs each August. 72 four- or five-member poetry teams from all over North America (and sometimes other parts of the world) get together for workshops, readings, networking, 2-AM-sidewalk-poetry, etc. The 72 teams compete over four nights in a series of 4-team bouts until one team is declared the champion.It's probably one of the most challenging and inspiring experiences a poet can have. [Why $1000?]Airfare: ~ $3000 Lodging: ~ $1000Total costs: ~ $4000 Funds raised from slams this year: ~ $2000Expected fundraising from June-August events: ~ $1000Total raised from other sources: ~$3000[What do the shirts look like?]I'm SO GLAD you asked! 
[What's a chapbook?]
A chapbook is a small book of poetry. In our case, we self-published it at Staples. Our chapbook contains 3 poems from each of our 5 team members.

story:
Home Stretch: Funding Goals nearly reached

We are happy to announce that we have raised over $10,000 so far of the $15k needed to pay for Cruz the Wave! In addition to this Indiegogo site, we've been holding local parties, raffles and garage sales to reach this amount, but still need help to pay our bills.

On the building side, we completed the last ribs yesterday (Sunday 13 July)! The next couple of work weekends will be spent packing up the rib sections onto pallets we need to make to be ready to be loaded on the 18 wheeler truck we have found that will carry the huge load to the playa.

Won't you consider helping us on the home stretch by contributing whatever amount you can to raise the funds to bring this massive project to Burning Man this year?

Cruz the Wave  is an homage to the great wave

An awe-inspiring, breath-taking and down-right HUMONGOUS art installation for Burning Man 2014.

Brought to you by a team of Santa Cruz Burners, Cruz the Wave is a 75 ft long, 18 ft high wave, to be surfed, explored and torched in what will undoubtedly be an amazing spectacle on Thursday night at Black Rock City!

A love letter from Santa Cruz to Black Rock City

Surfers, beachcombers and ocean lovers come frolic with us on the playa, surf the wave and dance the night away with this beautiful glowing structure.  Step into the surf, feel the ocean spray, meditate on the sounds of the sea around you.   Come back at night for a stunning light show as thousands of LEDs light up the interior of the curl.

Then what?

What will happen to the Wave once you build it?  

The Wave will be be built so that people can walk on it, climb it, ride it even! The interior of the Wave will be framed out to provide a space for Wave Lovers to walk through it and really be IN the Wave.  

And then...we BURN IT!  Yes, that's right!  We're going to Burn the Wave on Thursday Night!  We've even got an opportunity for YOU to participate in the Burn by lighting the fuse.  Check out our perks! 

Help us Create the Wave

In order to bring this enormous structure to the playa we need your help!  
Funds will go to:

  • Wood...so much wood!  Not to mention glue, screws & staples.  
    ($6,700)
  • The wave will be a multi-sensory experience complete with an audio track, misting and pretty lights!  
    ($3,500)
  • Playa Transport, trailer and expenses
    ($1500)
  • And of course if we're going to burn it to the ground, we need to have a burn platform of decomposed granite to protect the playa.
    ($2,500)

PLEASE DONATE!

Although we've already raised a lot of cash, we'll need to raise at least $8,000 more to make the wave happen.  We know we can do it but we need your help!

Donate to our campaign!  Imagine having front row seats at the burn, or having your name inscribed on one of the ribs of the wave.  Love surfing?  Come to our VIP party and meet the artists and build team.  Or be one lucky person to have the scale model of the wave at home in your house!  We cannot do this without you.  Please donate! 

Come join us! Get involved, help us build!  For more information, email info@cruzthewave.org.

Every little bit helps!  Like us on Facebook, share our story with your friends, help us meet our goal! 

Click here to go to the CruztheWave.org website

Meet the Team

The Wave is a community effort bringing together the Santa Cruz Burners - Unscruz and the artist and build team that brought you The Mayan Tricycle, in 2012.  The lead artist, wizzard, and lead builder, John each have over a decade of experience on playa and a lifetime of experience off-playa creating and building their artistic visions.  Backed by the Santa Cruz Burner community and a big group of enthusiastic volunteers from Unscruz, we are making this happen!

Courtesy of The Mayan Tricycle Team

Courtesy of wizzard (burningman.wizzard.com)
The Pagoda of Infinite Reflection (BRC 2004)
Intelligent Design (BRC 2006/2009)
The End (BRC 2008)

Below are just a few of the people building Cruz the Wave

Click to watch John's Interview

Click to watch wizzard's interview

Click to watch Rupert's Interview

Click to watch Mandy's Interview

Click to watch Wit's Interview

Click to watch AttaGirl's Interview



Thank you for the generosity of your time, money, friendship.  We cannot wait to see you in Black Rock City in August!

story:
On April 15, 2011, I took my first faceburgh photos. Since then I have taken and archived 23,000 photos. I seek to tell the story of Pittsburgh through the faces that we see everyday.

Almost all of my sidewalk portraits are of people in motion down the promenade. The faces I present are what we look like to others as we walk on the sidewalk. I offer no judgment or interpretation of their expressions. Merely, I hope to allow the viewer a moment to observe another human.

The Pittsburgh Post-Gazette did an article on faceburgh in May of 2012. You can learn more about me here:

http://www.post-gazette.com/stories/opinion/perspectives/faceburgh-making-a-mosaic-of-fellow-pittsburghers-634619/.

The money I seek is to cover the costs of the faceburgh exhibition which will open on September 19, 2013. The majority pays for the printing and hanging costs. Zoltun Design has taken me on as a pro-bono client. They are handling the design and implementation of the exhibit. Here is their design for the wall which is 50x15 feet. Note that the photos are just place holders and are not the final choices.

story:
Short Summary

Hi! This little adventure is called Vesselroom Project, a small art center in the transnational meeting point of Berlin, Kottbusser Tor. With a hybrid model, we will be showcasing artists from all over the world, unknown and renown, experienced and inexperienced. We want to display new media, explore new participatory models, investigate current trends. We want to do many things, but we need your help.

We are 3 girls with very different backgrounds: Cristina, from Spain, is a visual artist; Barbara, from Spain too, is a curator and writer; and Maycec, from France, is a self-publisher and photographer. But we all have the same aim: to create a space for reflection and artistic collaboration. We would like to encourage artistic production and support internationally up-and-coming artists.

Vesselroom Project was before an office space, and thanks to your collaboration, we will be able to transform it into a perfect space for displaying art.

What We Need & What You Get

The space needs a major renovation to become the Vesselroom Project.

We need to:

·  Change the floor

·  Take out the wallpaper, sand and paint again

·  Change the electric installation in order to improve the lighting system

·  Build a wall, so we can have place for storage

·  Build shelves for our library

All the help is more than welcomed, if we don’t rise the whole amount we will just partially do the refurbishment, waiting for more funding to come.


    Other Ways You Can Help

    Even if you can’t contribute, that doesn’t mean that you can’t help:

    • Get the word out and make some noise about Vesselroom Project
    • Come by and give us a hand with the renovation
    • Come along and show us your porfolio for further possible collaborations!

story:
Artwork by: Umer Ahmed [Powershift]

*Be sure to enter your email address while claiming a perk so we can contact you personally and discuss preferences.


*Contact us at: RavenBoltApparel@gmail.com for questions

Custom Vintage Logos & Artwork

LET'S GO VINTAGE!

20$ | TIER 1 | Custom Hand Lettered Text 

Hand lettered piece with up to two words to your preference (as shown in the example). The piece would be done on paper, each letter reflecting manual craftsmanship and bringing back the old era of sign writing and hand lettering. Each piece will be exclusively unique as it would be done by hand. 

You will receive this in .eps (vector) and .png format. 

Note: You will not receive the original piece on paper; you will receive the digital version respectively.

40$ | TIER 2 | Old School Black and White Logo

A one of a kind black and white logo with old school and vintage design elements, derived from the essence of logos from the 1920s to the 1970s, crafted finely to your preferences. 

You will receive this in .eps (vector) and .png format 

50$ | TIER 3 | Tier 2 + A Worn Vintage Rendition of the Logo

You will get the Custom Tier 2 logo rendered in a worn vintage manner, depicting aged old school logos and adding some decades to it. The worn vintage piece would also be provided in a 1920 x 1080 HD resolution wallpaper version along with the standard square version. 

You will receive the black & white logo in .eps (vector) and .png format a while the worn vintage rendition would be provided in .jpeg format. 

60$ | TIER 4 | Tier 2 + Mono Color Album Art

You will get the Custom Tier 2 logo along with a mono color vintage album art piece done to your preference with a hint of aged record covers. It can be flavored in the color of your preference and in either dark or light tones according to the style/genre of your music as you prefer. 
You will receive the black & white logo in .eps (vector) and .png format a while the album art would be provided in .jpeg format. 

80$ | TIER 5 | Full Color Logo + Worn Vintage Rendition

A full colored logo tailor made to your preferences with color and tone that bleeds vintage. It can also be a blend of modern and vintage design elements fused together. Your preferences of color and feel would be taken into account while crafting this so that you receive a piece that truly is exclusive and unique and embodies your taste in a beautiful vintage portrayal. Along with the logo, you will receive the worn vintage rendition in both a square and a 1920 x 1080 HD Wallpaper version. 

You will receive the logo in .eps (vector) and .png format a while the worn vintage rendition would be provided in .jpeg format.

120$ | TIER 6 | Tier 5 + Custom Artwork

You will get the full Tier 5 package with a custom vintage piece of artwork which can be anything from a poster to album art to a book or magazine cover. 


You will receive the logo in .eps (vector) and .png format a while the worn vintage rendition and the custom artwork would be provided in .jpeg format.

Advanced Packages 



160$ | TIER 7 | 


2 full blown full color logo options to choose from with the option of 1 adjustment or tweak if required. A worn vintage rendition of the final logo would be provided in a square and a 1920 x 1080 HD wallpaper version. Along with this you will receive 1 piece of custom artwork which can be anything from a poster to album art to a book or magazine cover. 

You will receive the logo in .eps (vector) and .png format a while the worn vintage rendition and the custom artwork would be provided in .jpeg format.

200$ | TIER 8 |

2 full blown full color logo options to choose from with the option of up to 2 adjustments or tweaks if required. A worn vintage rendition of the final logo would be provided in a square and a 1920 x 1080 HD wallpaper version. Along with this you will receive 3 pieces of custom artwork which can be anything from a poster to album art to a book or magazine cover. 


You will receive the logo in .eps (vector) and .png format a while the worn vintage rendition and the custom artwork would be provided in .jpeg format.
